author: Stefanie M.

description: Decent food but nothing super special. They do not have nearly enough wait staff employed as the service was extremely slow but the few waiters they had were running around like crazy. The desserts were very good though!
author: Michael D.

description: Awesome restaurant.  Great food, the service and ambience makes you feel like you have gone back in time.  For those who want an experience not just another Italian dinner come here.
author: April W.

description:
We went expecting old school red sauce Italian. What we got was a pale copy. A meal at a cheap chain Italian would have been far better. The calamari was overcooked. The "fresh pasta" was way over cooked! All of that might even be a bit forgivable but the supposedly "basil pesto" sauce had no actual basil. I also don't believe it had pine nuts. It appeared that they used parsley instead to cut cost. 

Then we get to the lasagna... oh my. My Italian ancestors would be rolling over in their graves. 
There was no ricotta, okay you can make lasagna with Besciamella instead. However it appeared they just used some cream in a flavorless tomato gravy. There was in fact almost no cheese of any kind! 

We left 90% of the meal and asked for the check. In a real Italian family restaurant they would have asked us "what's the problem?" instead they said okay. We paid and left. We stopped for a slice in little Italy instead. All I can say is tourist trap! Stay away, go for real Italian instead.
author: Rodney H.

description: Owner is beyond friendly. Food is amazing spaghetti and meatballs, bolognese and the alfredo. So good. Came back 2 nights in a row. Highly recommend this place if you're in San Francisco!! Good happy hour too. Come early for no wait and quick service. Bread is house made and soooo good.
author: Michelle L.

description: We discovered they have a jazz/swing combo that plays on Sunday afternoon s and Wednesday evenings.  It was a nice accompaniment to our excellent dinner.  The flattened chicken was moist and tasty.  The rack of lamb was well prepared, along with fresh vegetables.  An excellent meal.
author: Greg B.

description:
We visited with a group for our wedding rehearsal dinner. We found the positive Yelp reviews to be a good sign, and the staff were quick to reply to our inquiry for a group reservation. The process of selecting menus beforehand was fairly straightforward, too, and it was conveniently located a few minutes' drive from our family's hotel in Fisherman's Wharf. We'd also inquired about another place, but they didn't allow group bookings on weekends. 

The entrees and service were great! Someone (maybe a manager, or owner) came by to visit with us and congratulate us, and the ordering process was quite simple. We chose the smallest menu (caesar salad, basic entree, dessert/coffee) and figured we would order wine and other drinks to get to their food and beverage minimum. The other banquet menu options have more courses and more entree options-- I would've preferred more entree options within the fewer courses. 

My biggest issue was that the private room is bisected by the path to the kitchen, so every dish going out into the main room passed through ours. All that traffic on a busy Saturday night made us feel in the way trying to talk with family and friends at the other tables in the room. The staff did the best they could to be courteous about it, but it detracted from the ambiance of a 'private' room a bit. There may be other private rooms in the place, but from the banquet menu I got the impression they are for larger groups than ours. 

Other minor issues: 
-very few (I think just one, a pesto rigatoni?) vegetarian options for banquet menus. 
-caesar salad was SWIMMING in dressing. The lettuce was soggy, dressing too salty. Not inspiring.
-chicken cacciatore was the only non-pasta entree that had no vegetable side (it also had black olives in it, which seemed an odd choice with the mushrooms). 

All that said, everyone enjoyed themselves, the portions were very filling, and our food came out promptly. I couldn't finish my entree or dessert! 

I'm excited to come again for a regular dinner (after all, we got to see all the other dishes go by, and they looked quite nice), but I'll probably try another place for a group depending what I'm looking for and my budget.
author: Krista L.

description:
Great service, great menu which is available online(bonus). Veal Osso Buco will be hard to beat anywhere!!!!
Linguine con Polpetti (fettuccini and meat balls) was good.
Service is above the bar as are the desserts...save room!!!
author: Sonic J.

description: Tourist trap. From start to finish, poor experience. The menu had stains on it. The carpet was dirty. The service was rude. Had to return a glass of wine, they didn't apologize that we didn't like it, instead said the bottle has just been opened. From then the waiter was even more rude. The food was uninspired and way to expensive for what it was. This place reminds me of a bad Italian restaurant from the 1970's. Not a fine restaurant, more like a diner for tourists serving unrefined pastas plates for $17. The appetizer would have too much coleslaw without vinaigrette, a burnt bacon/shrimp and a tomato slice of poor quality that has no flavor at all. Cold atmosphere where you feel the waiter doesn't care at all since probably only tourists come and never return to such terrible "wannabe Italian" restaurant.
author: Claire M.

description: These guys are amazing! Half the price of the other places I researched for my son's graduation dinner with a greater selection, better service and fabulous location in north beach. The service was so warm and attentive, all my guests commented on how great the waitstaff was. Plus everyone loved their food! HIGHLY recommend for any group dinners!!! Plus EXCELLENT drinks.
author: Miren A.

description: Came to Fior d'Italia based on previous reviews. In general, it was a very good meal. The Tagliatelle Bolognese was outstanding (fresh pasta and a great Ragu). But when it came to dessert, I ordered Berries and Cream and what I got was fresh berries with plain heavy cream poured on top.  Not whipped and not sweetened (and no liquor infused). Definitely not what I was expecting. Big let down for an otherwise solid meal.
author: Paul Y.

description:
We picked the restaurant because it is dog friendly and it is people friendly too.
Had a great meal, best Ceasar salad in SF. Lovely handmade ravioli was great.
author: pat g.

description: Great food, but an immediate unpleasant odor hit me upon entering the restaurant; a dirty damp socks smell.
author: Cynthia F.

description: The best happy hour around, my favorite spot to stop after grocery shopping, or just to hang out. Great prices, and awesome bar tenders who make your visit worthwhile. Haven't come to the restaurant for dinner yet, but the band is always great.
author: Danielle H.

description: Fior d'Italia is near and dear to my heart as I've celebrated Christmas and now Thanksgiving here with my family.  Pasta made in-house, drinks served stiff, attentive service...it's old school Italian done right!
author: Alena W.

description:
Apparently the oldest Italian food restaurant in the city? Atmosphere here is ro-man-tic! Love the ambience, the dress of the waiters, the lighting, all of it. Perfect for a Friday date night out.

Italian is always a hit or miss game - you can only get a huge plate of pasta so interesting. That being said, I am a HUGE red sauce snob and this place does red sauce well! Definitely not the best I've tried, but surely cures that bolognase craving any day.
author: Patricia K.

description: The service and the food is top of the line. The best pasta in California. The service is also great and the owner is always walking around. It was so good that we had seconds.
author: Martin S.

description:
Super, super bland. I had the linguini tutto mare - lifeless tomato sauce with gritty clams, sandy mussels, and one overcooked shrimp. My fellow diner ordered the lasagne which looked like a microwaved frozen dinner and had a very similar taste. 

The only redeeming thing was the bread. It was warm and tasty.
author: A E.

description: I decided to try Fior d'Italia for dinner, based on reviews. I wasn't impressed as I hoped to be...the service was good though. But the food was average. The oysters tasted simple and my lasagna was rather stiff in some parts, perhaps over cooked? Under cooked? I don't know. We skipped desert and headed out. The restaurant itself is nice looking...should play some back ground music though (Frank Sinatra? Dean Martin?).
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description: Good food and service but, need more fans inside. Me and my girlfriend were so hot we were sweating!!!
author: Cesar R.

description:
This cute little place was our last stop for a meal before leaving San Francisco.  The restaurant is quaint and it has a great vibe.  

We ended up sitting at the bar so we could watch some of the games that were on and were met with great company of the bartenders.  The bar crowd was also fun and were apparently regulars to the restaurant.

For dinner we ordered 4 small plates that were all delicious.  

1. Tortellini alla Panna - Not sure what this means in Italian but it was a delicious  tortellini pasta filled with chicken and covered with a creamy alfredo sauce.

2. Bruschetta - Fresh tomatoes atop a crustini.  Very fresh. Very good.

3. Meat balls - This was one of my definite favorites.  They're delicious. Tiny little bites of meat smothered in a red sauce. Can't go wrong.

4. Cubes of sauteed filet in cream and pepper sauce - YUM! The steak is cut into small cubes and sauteed in more of a gravy sauce.  It almost feels like comfort food. So good.

At the end of the meal, I had a tiramisu martini made fresh with espresso... One of the best martini's I think I've ever had.  I also don't drink many of those.   

Overall, I'd go here again if we were to take a trip to San Francisco.  It was a great place to see a game, people were friendly and the food was delicious.  

Give it a shot!
author: Cindy R.

description: AMAZING! I come from am Italian family and we make our own pays and ravioli.  I'm typically very picky and love to eat at Italian restaurants and critique them. I got the ravioli bolognese, my husband got linguine  tutomarre and we skated a cannoli for dessert.  The food was FANTASTIC.  I highly recommend their authentic food and great service. It was like eating from my family kitchen!  AMAZING.
author: Kristy R.

description: Spend NYE with my wife and her cousins. Nice place to eat for a double date. We thought it was going to be busy but not so much. Appetizers we ordered calimari and the bad in wrapped shrimp. I ordered steak my wife ordered the homemade pasta. Her cousins order the steak for two. Both steaks were really good. Wife loved her pasta. With drinks and food came up to close to 200. It was totally worth it. Didn't feel rushed or anything.
author: John S.

description: Probably some of worst service we've ever had in the city. Down right rude and inattentive. Food was only mediocre. Now I know why half the restaurant was empty and it was easy to get a reservation. No reservations needed! This place is terrible. Go anywhere else.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Whatever you do DO NOT get the tagliatelle bolognese. It was bland, orangey, lacked meat flavor, and the noodles were chewy like rubber. Not sure if egg noodles are supposed to taste more chewy and have a rubbery texture, but the waiter told me that the only difference between those and normal flour pasta is the width of it.

1 star for nice music/ambiance, 1 star for the amazing service, 1 star for soft delicious bread as a starter, but NO NO NO on the tagliatelle.

Lovely location and music. I may go again just to get a glass of wine.
author: Fiona Y.

description:
The waiter is not friendly probably because it's new year's eve. He looks tired and impatient.
Also, I order the black rice with sea food, it's just ok. I expected that the sauce includes squid ink but it's just regular black rice. But my friends really like the steak and the chicken pasta.
author: Justice P.

description:
Oldest Italian restaurant in SF (1886)
The entrees $12 to $26, jacket and tie did not seem to be required but would not have been out of place. Waiters speak Italian and wear Black Dinner Jackets. Fior d' Italia serves authentic Northern Italian cuisine. Oysters on the half shell, Bistecca alla Fiorentina or oso bucco or rabbit with mushrooms yum. Finish with a tiramisu and cappucino.

Menu is exceptionally diverse, half orders are accommodated, three and five course sample menus are $30, $50 per person. Food is very good, service is very good, decor is good, bread exceptional. Wine list is studied with affordable good wines both Italian and American, but also has exception wines, some of which are offered by the Glass. A fine Borolo $20/glass.

All in all, this could easily become a favorite except I now live in North Carolina
author: Steven S.

description: I dont write a bunch of reviews.. but wow. Gr8 food... service was awesome.. dining room was full so i ate at the bar. Gio the bartender might be the best server i have ever had.. great vibe and hard to beat authentic italian.
author: Scott D.

description: Last night we had a wonderful dinner. Our waiter was fantastic and the service was great. I can't wait to come back.
author: Mark A.

description: Love coming back to this charming place every time you come home. Classics done well. Highly recommend! Plus say hi to Gia, he's the best.
author: Tony C.

description:
We were in San Francisco for my Wife's birthday celebration and I booked one night at Fior d'Italia after remembering it from the Travel Channel.

Having lived in San Fran for a number of years, I know there are heaps of excellent Italian restaurants.  So, our expectations were high as we knew this place surely must be something special. After all, the only other media star Italian restaurant in SF is "The Stinking Rose."

Our expectations were most certainly met and exceeded.  WOW!  What a wonderful experience we had.  The pastas and, one of my favs, the Ossobuco were simply - OUT OF THIS WORLD!

The food, service and atmosphere were all spectacular.  We cannot wait to return. Heck, we may even move back just to be closer to Fior - and the world's best Sourdough bread, of course.

My 2 Cents
Greg T.
author: Greg T.

description: I always find this place when in San Francisco.  Legacy decor you may remember from movies in the 70s.  All freshly updated with pictures of former movie stars.  Servers are mostly experienced men who have been there for years.  Food is excellent.  Service is excellent.  Good variety on the menu.
author: Gary W.

description: A lovely neighborhood restaurant with delicious, authentic Italian food. Executive chef/owner is from Milan and we had a tasty meal of pasta and risotto. Meal arrived hot. Bread was a near-perfect white bread. Our waiter was attentive and efficient (we were under time-constraints). Would definitely go back.
author: KT H.

description:
UNBELIEVABLE experience. I have been all over the globe eating Italian food, this is some of the best. The bartender, manager, and waiter were bantering in Italian. I loved it and I was also jealous. My girlfriend was with me. I now need to go home and figure out a way to compensate for taking her into a restaurant where Italian men cooked phenomenal Italian food. 
The pasta is made fresh daily. Our food was amazing. The staff was so nice. The bread, yes the bread, was some of the best I've ever had. I have no reason to leave this place. If I could sleep here, I would. TV's, bar, and great food... Wait, there's a hotel upstairs. I'll see you tomorrow morning.
author: Jacob H.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant not in Italy.  Started dinner with a double plate of Gnocchi which we ordered with pesto and pine nut sauce which was not on menu.  Split it between 4 people as an appetizer and it was delicious! For a main had pasta seafood and shell fish, prawns and scallops were all fresh and delicious.  Great service wonderful Tiramisu to end it, highly recommend!
author: Jeff F.

description:
When I called to make a reservation, the person who answered the phone could barely be bothered to take down the details (I wanted to let him know that it was a special occasion.)

I arrived early to ensure I was seated at a good table and to request a birthday dessert + candle for my guest. The maître d' was busy on the phone and a man wearing kitchen overalls offered to help. I declined and said I would rather wait ( so that to arrange for a birthday dessert, etc.), at which point he identified himself as the owner who was on his way out the door. By this time I was already having second thoughts.

The dinner was a birthday celebration for a fiend.  Although the food was satisfactory, the service was uneven due a dinner meeting event in a private dining room. Evidently our waiter was working in both dining areas and disappeared from time to time and I had to go in search of him to order a cocktail and again to ask for some more bread after the first request went unanswered. 

I ordered dessert while my guest left the table to visit the ladies room and when I reminded the waiter that I had requested a birthday candle, evidently this important detail had not been passed along to him beforehand. 

We both have better memories of the old Fior d'Italia restaurant when it was located on Washington Square.
author: sf k.

description: Had the pleasure of going to hear Jelly Roll Jazz group w the delightful, lovely voice of Denise Blondo. It was the perfect setting for a chilly, San Francisco night. I ordered the tortellini alla panna w a glass of Markham Merlot, which was absolutely delicious! It was like finding a treasure right in SF, since homemade pasta of this quality is not the easiest to find.  I had a wonderful time hearing  Denise & her great band & will definitely be going back, especially for that homemade pasta!! "Mmh mmh good", as the saying goes!! Divine, divine, divine!!
author: Debbie C.

description:
The staff were excellent; service and friendly!
My wife's and I both enjoyed our delicious meals.
author: Richard A.

description: It's not a personal vendetta , we were so disappointed with the restaurant and the waste of money, that probably two posts would still have been good .
author: Bill T.

description: Great dinner place! We went last night and enjoyed everything we had! I had the bolognese and the wife had the spaghetti and clams - so good! Service and atmosphere was on point!
author: Matt P.

description:
I really liked seeing all the historical newspaper articles and relics from throughout the years. We did not know that we were dining at America's first Italian restaurant until we saw it printed everywhere inside. It was fun to ponder about all the people who have dined here.

We were just craving some good ol' al denta pasta action and headed to North Beach. We came at an awkward time for lunch (3pm on a weekday), when a lot of other Italian restaurants in North Beach were closed between lunch and dinner service. Luckily, Fior d'Italia was open, and no one else but a big party of Brazilian tourists was inside. Score! We serendipitously enjoyed a relaxing lunch with very prompt and friendly service and what we came for: tons of carbs! The pesto and pine nut pasta was superb, and the bolognese just hit the spot. Every last crumb of appetizer bread was used to wipe the sauce off our plates. Can't speak for any of the more expensive entrees, as we only ordered pastas. I also can't speak for peak times, but hey, if you're not doing anything for weekday lunch, this would be a delicious option :)
author: Tuwie N.

description:
Just had to try the oldest Italian restaurant in America. We were definitely not disappointed. It was a short walk from our hotel through a nice neighborhood. The inside is cozy and walls are covered with over a hundred years of photos and memorabilia. The host is very welcoming and made us feel at home though we felt underdressed in jeans. He said " come on in we are a family restaurant." 
For an app we had wanted to try meatballs that we had seen on yelp, but they no longer had it on menu. They were nice enough to bring us two in sauce and even extra bread for he incredible sauce. Meatballs had a silky texture- just fantastic. I had the incredible ravioli di zucca and HIGHLY recommend it. The homemade pasta is heavenly and that butter sauce had just the right amount of salt to contrast the sweetness of the pumpkin. We also had the tagliatelle bolognese and the tortellini al pana. The bolognese was rich and hearty and the homemade pasta is just so much better than dried. We also had the house Chardonnay which was pretty good. 
Overall the service, ambiance and the food are absolutely worth a trip! I wish we had room for dessert. Maybe next time.
author: Terrell B.

description:
If you're looking for great ambiance, this is your place. For food, maybe not so much. 

From outside on the sidewalk this place looks very romantic, with all the plants and twinkling lights, then you walk inside and the tables are set up with lit candles and a single rose at each one. It's a great place to sit and enjoy each other's company. Adding to the atmosphere is the live jazz music (perhaps not available every night? was there when I went) and the amazing service. The waiters treated us like family and tended to us quickly and efficiently. 

Unfortunately, for a restaurant that seemed so nice, their food was subpar. My thirteen year old sister described it best, "It's yummy. Not terrible, not delicious, just yummy". I think what she meant to say was "edible". The food was plated nicely, but after taking a bite I couldn't help but think it was missing something. We all agreed it lacked flavor, perhaps a seasoning of some sort, salt even. Definitely overpriced for the simple, tasteless food we received. 

I'd like to give this restaurant the benefit of the doubt and hope that perhaps we ordered the wrong items (the four of us at dinner ordered pastas: ravioli di zucca [x2], fettuccine ai tre latti, & lasagne al forno) and maybe the other meals on their menu are a lot better prepared, because we really did have a nice time. 

8/10 for overall experience.
author: Alejandra D.

description:
The staff was super busy when we got there, but the upside was the chef discreetly came out and attended to us with cheer and humor.  The wine and food were delicious.  And the live music (a jazz ensemble with horns! and a washboard percussionist / trombone player) was so much fun!

Thank you nice Chef!
author: Alanna L.

description: Not my cup of tea! Friend of mine said this place was one of few he loves to visit when in the Bay Area. I had to take my chances and try it out. As I said at the beginning, not my cup of tea! It's not bad, just not as great as he described it. It's pricey as well, not that this was an issue, merely a disclosure to those looking to visit this place. I wouldn't be back unless I'm meeting here w friends
author: Rolando F.

description:
Don't ever go with a hat
Owner Johnny is real a hole!

Rude

No wonder place is empty
author: Jay M.

description:
It's rare to find a nice, upscale Italian restaurant for only $$ in the middle of SF, so I'm definitely keeping this one on my list. My friend and I were greeted by an overly enthusiastic host, who immediately showed us to our seats without needing any reservations. The waiter who served us seemed a bit confused and didn't speak much English but was very attentive with refilling our waters and clearing our dishes, even though the restaurant was full. 

We started with cocktails. I had the Venezia Martini "The Trixie" ($11) which had Pear Vodka, Triple Sec, and a Squeeze of Lime. Light and fruity but still strong. My friend had the Torino Martini ($11) which had Citron Vodka, Punt & Mes, and Orange Zest. Also strong and very satisfying. A+ on the cocktails!

For appetizers we ordered the Caesar Salad ($7) and Roasted Potatoes ($7). The salad was soaked in dressing (maybe a little too much) but was flavorful and filling. The potatoes (cut into the shape of rounds) were good but the fact that they were sitting in a giant puddle of olive oil was not very appealing.

Onto the entrées. I'm generally a huge fan of Pumpkin Ravioli so I ordered the Ravioli di Zucca ($16) which is pasta stuffed with pumpkin, amaretti and mustard fruit with a butter, pinenuts and sage sauce. YUM! I would totally get this again. The saltiness of the sage sauce had a surprisingly delightful contrast to the sweetness of the pumpkin. Plus the crunchiness of the pinenuts adds a nice variety of texture.

My friend got the Linguine con Polpette ($16) which is linguine, tomato sauce, and meatballs. The meatballs were impressive! They were fresh and cooked perfectly. The sauce had a slight spicy kick to it. Simple yet delicious. 

The food was plentiful and the experience was classy. Would definitely come back here again and recommend this restaurant to others.
author: Stefanie C.

description: The food is good but the service is sloooow. We and our party of eight waited for over an hour for our entrées to arrive.
author: Marco C.

description: Service was slow due to a busy evening, thus the maitre d serviced us.  Great gent!  Great food.  Overall, love it.  Great place to go prior to a race.
author: Bob M.

description:
This place has really gone downhill. They're one the oldest restaurants in San Francisco and for decades the food and service was some of the best in the city. Recently their service has become sub-par with surly waiters who pressure you to buy the higher priced meals and wines, and who are much less than attentive. The food was once some of the best Italian anywhere. Now it's obvious they're using inferior produce and meats, and the wonderful flavors are all gone. Just bland, dull, and overpriced. 

My best advice - stay far away from Fior d'Italia.
author: Del H.

description:
Once we found out, after reading reviews, that this is the oldest Italian restaurant in the US, it of course became a must-go-to. 

Decor is what you'd expect of an older Italian restaurant. Not modern, waiters wore older fashioned uniforms, menu was relatively typical. Had a little bit of everything. 

We had the buratta (very small portion compared to what you're paying for it), clams & mussels, and mushroom shallot risotto. The one thing I will say which was omnipresent in the last 2 dishes was the SALT content. Went through two whole glasses of water and I barely ever take a sip of anything while I eat (old habit). 

Other than that, everything was delicious. Good amount of time between each dish.
author: Danielle D.

description: What a lovely restaurant! Wonderful ambience and terrific food; it reminded me of a restaurant in Florence that I love. I had the pumpkin ravioli and vegetables of the day, and both were delicious. It's obvious why this place has lasted for more than a hundred years
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Fantastic ambiance, traditional Italian.  Very much reminds me of Mulberry street in NY, Little Italy.  We had the lasagna, pumpkin ravioli, risotto, and appetizers.  Everything was prepared in real italian tradition.  Will return when in San Francisco, and highly suggest as a must go to when in North Beach.
author: Peter G.

description:
Wonderful service!  Delicious food!  Great old fashioned Italian ambiance!  Will definitely return next time I am in San Francisco!  The oldest Italian restaurant in the country!  It brought back memories of my youth when we would go to Dino's in Pasadena, only better, actually!  We went after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon, so it was a late dinner.  The bar is a lovely old wooden one with fast and cheerful service.  Our booth was perfect!  We were even given the choice of a booth or table!  Wow! Talk about servicing the needs of the customers!

Since it was late, we couldn't eat as much as we would have liked, lol!  I have a delicious Caesar and then the Scallopine Fior. As soon as the first bite hit my mouth, the flavor absolutely burst with lusciousness!!!  Marsala, mushrooms, prosciutto....garlic....nothing overpowering just delicious.  My daughter had the bucatini and my son the ravioli di zucca AND the osso buco con polenta.  Needless to say, we were too stuffed to have dessert, which was sad considering the options!

Thank you Fior d'Italia for a scrumptious meal and memorable experience!
author: K.c. D.

description:
So we had a party of 3. One of us had the veal which was very good. The pesto pasta was less than good very bland not much flavor to speak of.

I had the ravioli, which was suppose to have beef and veal in it. Not really sure what kind of meat was in it was. The meat tasted freezer burned, and the sauce had no flavor.

The dish consisted of 8 ravioli. I ate the first one and was disappointed. I always give it a second try just to make sure I don't like it. That left 6 ravioli.

I give one to my wife to try to make sure I'm not crazy and she didn't like it either. That left 5.
I ate another 1/2 of one and I couldn't do it. The ravioli just wasn't palatable. There were 4 1/2 ravioli left out of 8.

I call the waiter over and told  him that I tried to eat it but it wasn't edible. 

The waiter "Alberto" started giving attitude and said that I had eaten it. And really didn't seem to care that it wasn't any good. 

I was taken back by the attitude and the rude behavior. I told him to forget it and to just take the meal off the bill. 

I had heard the food was pretty good here but was very disappointed with the service and the food. Alberto's attitude just set the tone for the rest of the meal and for everyone else. 

The veal was good though.
author: Angela M.

description: Great, really great, food. Wonderful atmosphere, excellent, proper, bar. I love places with history, or at least a good story. I will definitely be back.
author: Joe k.

description:
It has been awhile since I gave out 5 stars to anyone. This night was special.
I have always wanted to go to the oldest Italian restaurant in the U.S. which opened in 1886. Finally made it.
They have had several locations and are currently on the main floor of the San Remo Hotel.

I was extremely surprised by the food. Not that I didn't expect good food, but this was very good.
We had a group of 10 and they put us in our own little room which was great because we were kind of loud.
We started off with the Prosciutto con Frutta di Stagione for appetizers which was very fresh, very good.
I had the New York steak and the sauce it was covered in was amazing. My wife had the Salmon which was equally good.
I didn't look at the wine list as someone else ordered the wine but what we had was very good.

The service was perfect. This has to be a go to next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I went here previously and was happy with the dinner.  this time it was not so impressive and since i said the prior experience was good, i now owe my wife!

First comment is that the services was fine.  Timely and friendly.  

Second, my wife started out with a cocktail that, if you wanted to just get drunk, would have been impressive.  It was loaded with alcohol but lacked taste.

As for the meals, she had the prawns wrapped in pancetta for an app.  It was tasted though the shrimp looked old.  I had the prosciutto and melon.  the melon was fine but eh prosciutto was not fresh.  it looked dark and was dry tasting.  

For dinner my wife had the pouched salmon.  it did not look fresh, was soaked in water and ultimately was tasteless.  The potatoes were good but the green bean were soaked in oil.  I had the tagliatelle with the bolognese sauce.  While it was dry, the taste was fine. The one main problem i had is in almost all italian restaurants they come table side to see if you want cheese on the dish.  i am not a fan of the cheese so i skip it.  this place just loaded it on.  took me a while to clean it off.

finally the dessert was not impressive.  My wife had the mousse and it was closer to a cake then mousse.  It was dry.  I had the berries and cream and it looked like berries in a cup of milk, no real tasted was added due to the cream (they would be better for using whip cream).

So for the price, it was not worth the investment plus the ambiance is not present.  Just feels like an old place that needs infusion.
author: Tim F.

description: A friend recommended we visit this establishment and we decided to give it a try. I got the Ravioli with meat sauce as it was the plate he recommended. It was very delicious and tasted homemade and original. Not the biggest fan of ravioli but I have to say I liked it so much I will come by when I'm the area. The portion isn't the biggest and at a moment I thought I wouldn't get full but I was wrong. My bf had their pesto pasta with grilled chicken and I gave his chicken breast a quality check and it was very flavorful, he wasn't a big fan of the angel hair but he said as far as flavor went it was good. Service was good and restaurant was clean, the only problem is parking but almost every business in Frisco has that issue.
author: Ali N.

description: From the moment we walked in the door we felt welcomed. Our waiter was very attentive and when he was tied up with others the manager came over and took our order. The wine suggestions were spot on as well as the entree suggestions. The desserts are a must. So save a bit of room
author: Cynthia H.

description:
The girlfriend and I came here armed with a groupon this weekend.   The place was pretty empty at 6pm on Saturday, but the bar was lively.

First off, this place had really good bread, olive oil and vinegar.  Very Italian.

We ordered the bacon wrapped shrimp.  Out come four tasty, but very salty, large shrimp.  

Next, I order the veal with polenta and veggies.  The veal was very tender and tasty, but again, very salty.  This time, it wasn't too bad because the polenta was a little bland so mix them together and it masks the saltiness of the veal.

For dessert, we had the cooked pudding, which was bland, but the sauce was good.


The service was very good and the waiter was funny without being awkward.

There were some flies buzzing around, but only because they keep the doors open.
author: Richard T.

description:
I had dinner here with my family while on vacation. 
Pros:
- felt welcomed at the restaurant on arrival 
- the second lemonade was good (the first was a little watery, but the second was stronger). Note, the lemonade is made with sparkling water
- the ravioli bolognese was good

Cons:
- the calamari was waaaaaay overcooked (it was like chewing hard rubber). To the restaurant's credit, they took it back without any fuss
- the prosciutto was okay, but a little too thickly sliced (so it was a little more chewy than usual)
author: Pop L.

description: Excellent!  All around great.  Food was diverse and authentic.  Prices were a little high but worth it.  Atmosphere was fun.  Very cool for the historical factor . The service was also very very good.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Absolutely delectable. Awesome, friendly service.  I ordered linguine con Palette. I could barely finish it with two huge flavorful meatballs and delicious perfectly cooked pasta ! Will always remember to return here for some good pasta!!
author: Deanna N.

description:
I loved this place!
The staff was really friendly and it had an authentic feel of a family owned Italian restaurant. The food was delicious, you can just tell when pasta is freshly made. It had a great atmosphere and can't wait to go back again.
author: Skyler C.

description: For the oldest continuously open Italian restaurant in the US, they keep the place up. Solid selection of dishes. Very accommodating to menu changes. Good sized portions. Cesar salad is a traditional stand out. Staff is excellent especially Gil. Worth going out of your way for.
author: Alison S.

description: Don't come here if you want really good Italian food. The man who served my family and I was rude. Seemed annoyed when I asked for things like water, cheese and more bread (asked very politely). When I asked him if I could have more bread, he responded "more? Another one?!" Like yeah, I want more bread to eat with my food!!! Ps I only asked for bread twice. Now the food. I ordered the seafood linguine (forgot the name) and it was too salty & ive had way better. My sister ordered the gnocchi and the taste was alright, but it was very mushy unlike other gnocchi we've had.
author: Helen S.

description:
If you can't fly to Italy tonight, just go to Flor d'Italia.
AMAZING pastas! They offer homemade pastas that are
out of this world! We ordered four different homemade pastas.
Each shape and sauce was 10 out of 10.
I wish I had a bigger stomach in order to eat more.
The waitstaff is kind, patient, and warm. The environment is 
anything but stuffy, and the prices should be higher.
Solid 5 stars in all respects.
author: May C.

description: With so many great Italian restaurants, it's still surprising to find another one and Fiore D'Italia deserves to be on your short list.  Portions could be a tad larger but the food was so good I'm possibly, subconsciously simply being greedy.  Their Gnocchi was superb, sold for adults, teens, and children alike.  House wine was more than solid which I rarely have the luck of saying.  Their bread was rustic, warm, and with just the right texture. I highly recommend this over all but two other Italian restaurants I've been to which puts it in the top three over 35 years of going in to the city on weekend nights.
author: Lewis C.

description: Good recommendation by our hotel staff. I had veal piccata and my husband had veal scaloppine. It was tender and flavorful. The wine recommendation was good. Nice staff. Would recommend.
author: Lisa D.

description:
Have to say I was a little worried when we walked in and the restaurant was full to capacity!  Why you ask?  That's a good sign right!?? Usually, yes, but the tables were long banquet style set up and we realized it was a HUGE Birthday party.  I thought. We will wait forever for service and food... Wrong on both counts.  My husband and I and teenage daughter couldn't have been treated better.  We are given a wonderful table away from the crowd and I have to say the service was impeccable.  Not sure where reviews of poor service came from.???  we noted that servers not even waiting on us stopped to fill water,take plates , even grab me a side of ice for my wine as the saw me negotiate a cube from my water! That's paying attention folks!  
Gil was our primary waiter and had great suggestions throughout the meal from apps, wine and dessert !  Started with appetizer of grilled shrimp, prosciutto wrapped melon, tomato and mozzarella slices. Wonderful start!  Hubby had rack of lamb. Cooked "super rare", just as requested!  I had the steak ( again perfectly cooked) with the grappa sauce..  delish. Daughter had the 1/2 chicken and said she couldn't stop eating it was sooo good! Ordered a salad and side of sautéed spinach for the table as well.  Finished with the non traditional tiramisu ( that we didn't have room for),but scrapped the dish clean in seconds.
The owner was watching the floor and the kitchen ,I suspect, to make sure all was well.  He stopped by our table to say hello and ask if all was well.. in all honesty we told him it was the best meal and by far the very best service we had during our stay in San Francisco.  And that's the truth!
author: DD B.

description: On recommendation by the Hotel we walked here. Such a cute authentic place!  Great local vibe, excellent service and the food was fantastic. Burrata salad was the best ever despite the tomatoes being out of season. The bolognese....I will dream about!  Putting this in my places to come back to
author: Dana A.

description:
Awesome service. Delicious food. Classy ambiance.  That about sums up my experience here but if you want to know more, here it is:

-calamari was perfectly fried, accompanying sauces were tasty too
-fresh cantaloupe with prochuitto was also a nice light starter
-the olive oil and balsamic vinegar made the house bread even better
-enjoying freshly made gnocchi and ravioli was a great treat
-one diner did say she felt her food was salty but otherwise everyone loved the experience here
-restaurant decor is beautiful including the table linens and a fresh rose on each table
-love that the staff dresses eloquently and most of the patrons dress up a bit too
-staff was top notch here, very attentive, warm and friendly
-lots of locals and some tourists

(As seen on Travel Channel's "Food Paradise - Pasta Paradise")
author: Courtney K.

description: This place is mediocre. It has an old school setting and the entrance is a little odd. You would have to go through the second door next to it and walk through the restaurant to meet host. You'll see what I mean.. The service is a little disjointed and seemed like they had less staff. I had their wine, paso creek Cabernet which was really good. If you like dark, bold wine, I highly recommend that. Overall it was ok/decent.
author: Jenn L.

description:
I want to preface this review with a statement that I rarely write poor reviews, and that this is without a doubt the worst I have ever written. 

My wife and I just finished dinner at Italia D Fior. I am not sure what the name means in English, but I assume it is Italian for "Terrible Service".  The food was good, but it seemed that since we ordered from the low end of the menu & did not order wine or drinks we were more of an inconvenience than a valuable guest. 

I was drinking only water (due to a health issue). I politely asked the waiter twice, over a ten to fifteen minute period, for additional water. He acknowledged me on both occasions, but water never came. I had also asked for additional bread during this time, but I guess my allotment was 1 slice. 

When I told the waiter my concerns he got huffy and hurried off. I spoke with the manager to let him know of my concerns. He listened, but I am not sure I feel he really gets it. 

By the way, when I order water, I normally tip 25 to 30% to offset the missing drink.
author: Glenda B.

description: The Best in San Francisco!  Came in for a late dinner on Valentines with my wife and 10 year old daughter she loved the butter noodles  service  was just ok on Valentines i do understand there working on turning  tables on a day like today! And didn't  expect  the best services!
author: Jay F.

description: Saw reviews and needed some place that would take 6 people with a reservation. The best part of the meal was the warm sour dough bread served at the beginning. Go elsewhere.
author: Laurie M.

description: If you're staying in the wharf area, walk a bit south away from that mess. I was stuck in this area for work and could not find a decent meal by the water. Fior d'Italia was amazing. I ended up here 2 nights in a row, one night with the risotto, the next night I ordered the flattened chicken. Great service and delicious meals both nights. Great live jazz band one of the nights.
author: Jenny A.

description: Enjoyed a dinner here after it was recommended by a guy at our hotel. Service was great, and the food was extremely fresh and perfectly prepared. My husband had the special, which was salmon, and I had the fettuccine Alfredo. I would love to come back.
author: Denise P.

description: This is the first time I'm posting a review, ever. The food was delicious, the service was even better!  I ordered fish that, for some reason, was significantly over salted.  The personal was very courteous and I believe the owner himself came out to express himself in a very polite manner.  I was ready to pay for the dish and to my surprise the Fior took upon itself to take the dish off my bill.  I enjoyed the experience greatly on many levels and I will, without doubt, come back over and over when in San Francisco.
author: Gor S.

description: Friendly, gracious, and delicious, Fior d'Italia delivers on its promise of excellent Italian food, coupled with first class service. Everything was delicious from start to finish. I can personally vouch for the lasagna as being the best I've ever tasted. And the staff could not have been nicer or more attentive. Our sole regret dining here was that we were too full after our fabulous meal to try their desserts. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area.
author: Brian A.

description: Great old school San Francisco Italian charm. Great drinks, food, and friendly charming waiters. I definitely recommend this place.
author: David B.

description: Had a wonderful dining experience this weekend when we visited the City. Our server, who's name I did not get, was absolutely wonderful. Even though the restaurant was busy, it felt like he was doting on us, which was nice. We split the trio sampler appetizer. I had the gnocchi for my main course and it was delicious!! Like little tender melty pillows of heaven. Splurged for dessert and got the chocolate mousse which was insane! It was so thick and rich there was no way I could even attempt to finish it. Well done!
author: Mindy H.

description: This restaurant was recommended by our hotel concierge. The food we ordered was good Italian food. We are an Anglo-Saxon Italian family, who travels often to Italy. The only gripe we have was the waiter in charge of the bar tonight, who was rude.  Our waiter, however, was attentive and kind, also he apologised about the barman's behaviour when I mentioned it. I did not feel he should do this. The bar man just needs to learn to welcome tourists.
author: Caro F.

description: Oldest Italian restaurant in America has a pretty chill bar that I like to pop into especially on Sunday's when there is live jazz playing :)  The cocktails are delicious and there are several beers on tap. A good mix of locals and hotel stayers are usually here and the bartenders serve w a smile!
author: Justina L.

description:
I used to eat here when they were in their old space on Washington park now occupied by original joes.
Anyways i thought i would give it another try after the move.
The food was plain old bad. The food was low quality. My dish tasted like it was made from a can and was very disappointing.
If you want good Italian food in North beach go to original joes or north beach restaurant both are great. Stay away from this restaurant.
author: B G.

description: Service was fantastic. We got a private room with red curtain. Refilled drinks and food presented well. The steak I got was delicious. Lasagna was ok and spaghetti was great. The portion of lasagna was small.
author: Ashley C.

description:
My husband and I had just finished walking up and down the Lombard road and wanted a bite to eat. Of course we yelped Italian restaurants near little Italy and this place seemed legit. So we walked there. 

APPEARANCE & LOCATION: The place was in an easy to find spot and within good walking distance from where we were.  This restaurant is at corner (I can't remember the street names but you can find the cross streets under the address). Anyway, location  appearance . In fact it was very nice. Well put together. There were only 3 other tables being served at the time and we got their at about lunch time. It was a nice, clean, peaceful environment. And very elegant yet it had a casual feel.
PRICE: was a bit up their. But it was worth it for the high quality food 
FOOD: They serve you sliced bread while you wait to order. And that bread was delish!  Both mine and my husbands meals were terrific! (see posted pic of our meals and prices) Keep in mind that I'm not experienced in Italian cuisine and the closest to authentic Italian food that i have tasted is from bucca or macaroni grill, so go ahead, take my review with a grain of salt  but, to me, this place was by far the best Italian food i have ever had! I was going to get a sandwich but the waiter suggested a pasta being that pasta is their specialty. glad i took his advice.
CUSTOMER SERVICE: Our waiter was a young guy but don't let his age fool you. He was actually professional, kind, attentive, helpful with suggested menu items and kept a good balance of decent convo that didn't get obnoxious or desperately obvious if he was trying to up his tip. He also was the only server for all 4 tables and came to our table often. We never had to ask for refilled drinks, he brought our food when it was nice and hot and frequently checked on us and the other tables. He even gave us good tips on places to see while on our vacation her in SF!
author: Rayonica C.

description: This is our 3rd visit here. Always such an awesome staff experience- so friendly and quick to help. 3 out of 4 of us always get the homemade pasta with meatballs while my husband likes to try different seafood dishes or the veal. We are consistently happy with the food and service!!
author: Kim K.

description: The scallops were unbelievably delicious, and the grilled cheese was divine. My companions had the gumbo, stew, and chicken and all were out of this world. The best food we've had in a while.
author: Rebecca C.

description: What can I say, it's not little Italy, but it's a wonderful little restaurant in the historic San Remo hotel.  Greeted warmly by the manager and the owner ( who is also the head chef.). He made my son smile (which is a hard thing to do.  We were seated right away, and given water and offered bread.  It took a little while for our waiter to appear, but once he did, his attentiveness made up for his delay.  That's one thing I can say, they have a level of attentiveness that is difficult to find anywhere.  Let's just say, a person could drown as full as they keep your water glasses.  The wait staff and owner have an amazing knowledge of wine and pairings for dishes.  Or did was all fantastic.  You could tell it was homemade pasta with scratch sauces.  I had tagliatelle a la bolgenes.  Wonderful flavor, not to miss sauce.  My son went with a creamy fettucini Alfredo, and my wife a spiced pumpkin ravioli.  We we're all pleased.  Plenty of visits by the waiter, the owner, and the manager that you wanted for nothing.  A genuine handshake and warm goodbye from the manager, even to my son (the kid).  I would go again when in the area.
author: Greg M.

description: Eat at bar for happy hour,  and only when Geo is there.  Best deal in city for happy hour.  Simple apps that are more American Italian then authentic Italian.  Great ambiance.  Can bring your dog in at bar if you like.  Geo always gives personalized service.  Have Peroni on draft and Geo makes a tasty cocktail.
author: John K.

description: The service was amazzzzing!!!! The Peppercorn Crema New York Steak was simply the best EVER!
author: Crissy C.

description:
This place a little walk from or hotel. Very cute place. Awesome food! I had the rosemary chicken and my wife hade the salmon. Both cooked perfect. The potatoes and sauce where delicious. 
The only thing wrong was our waiter. No personality. Kind of rude I would say. My wife said he rolled his eyes at me a couple of times. He had a skinny little mustache. There is some people that can't rock the stash and he is one of them. Lol. I'm being rude now, all in all great food!
author: James C.

description: We've picked this place because it claims to have authentic northern Italian cuisine (which is unfortunately very rare in the US) and we weren't disappointed! We had the escargot and oysters for starters and then linguini tutto mare and bucatini amatriciana for the main course. It was very good, the taste was great and the pasta was cooked right. The wine recommendations were spot on as well, we had the super tuscan and a pinot noir. We'll be back!
author: Jens K.

description:
Food was okay. We got the risotto, linguine with tomato sauce and meatballs, and pumpkin ravioli. 

The poached pear was the best dessert. 

Total was $110 for three entrees, three desserts, a cocktail, and a soda. 

Ambiance was pretty nice- standard old Italian, playing Sinatra, and flattering lighting. Full of tourists, but not obnoxious. 

Would recommend to people staying at fisherman's wharf as solid, family friendly food.
author: Meredith K.

description: The fresh made pasta is delicious! Especially the fettuccine alfredo with grilled chicken. The lasagna meat sauce was too 'meaty' for my taste, but my husband loved it. I also had a killer dirty martini, very yum ;)
author: Kristina M.

description:
What an absolute disaster! Came here on thanksgiving day to celebrate with friends. 

Excruciatingly bad service from the waiter who was pretty rude. 

He got our orders wrong, gave us bread but no vinegar or olive oil - then ignored our request for it. 

Food came sporadically and late for one of the kids. 

Terribly bland, sloppy food which was obviously heated in the microwave. Shockingly presented - pretty much slapped onto the plate. 

To top it off - they got our bill badly wrong.


How this joke shop is 4 stars is beyond me. Expensive, rude, tripe! 

Probably won't shut down due to the local clientele who eat there regularly, thinking this is real 'quality' food or unsuspecting out-of-towners. 

AVOID!
author: James M.

description: This place smells so bad I had to abandon my friends and family. If you have a weak (or strong, I guess) nose then DO NOT come here.
author: Thombre K.

description: Food delicious, staff friendly, prices reasonable for the location and quality of the food. Even custom made a dish for my picky friend!
author: Emily K.

description: I was referred by the Hyatt concierge as a very special place to go to celebrate Thanksgiving. The service was poor. Had to ask three times for water. Never came back to ask if we wanted cheese or pepper. The gnocchi with bolognese was put  down on the table room temperature and the waiter never returns. After waiting 7 minutes we ask another waiter to see our waiter and he got us some cheese.  Now from lukewarm to cold. The other dishes veal and chicken were bland and hardly edible. I had many places I could have gone to and enjoyed a great meal with great service. I wasted 150 dollars for a totally poor experience.  I will make sure to tell the concierge thank you for ruining my Thanksgiving dinner.
author: Rabbi W.

description: Super awesome neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Great ambiance...great food.great service.  Dont live in SF but would eat here often if I did.  Overall great experience!!  Our server Gil was fantastic..great ideas for dinner, excellent and quick service even though they were slammed busy.  Lot of fun!!
author: Steven K.

description:
Nice setting, valet parking, and a good verity of tradition Italian food. The service is also very good, waiters are on point. 

I have been coming here for years and the last time I went I felt like the food wasn't as good as I remembered. Having said that I would still recommend for a date spot or family outing.
author: Marcus P.

description: Ambiance is pretty nice. Enjoyed our first waiter before the second took over. Food was just OK. Two of the three plates came out cold. Lasagna was too salty, and cream-based dish was too bland.
author: Robin S.

description:
I really wanted to like this restaurant. Came in on a Saturday night just before 9pm. The restaurant was not full, however there was no one to receive guests at the host's desk. Waited for a couple of minutes until a waiter passed, said someone would be there shortly and then patted my shoulder. UGH. 

Finally someone came along, showed me to a cute little corner table. Ordered calamari as a starter. It was OK, nothing special. Ordered the risotto bolognese as a main. It was terrible. The pasta was OK but the meat in the was bland, and had the consistency of blended patted down meatloaf. Didn't taste like meat at all.  Really bad. I could find better box raviolli. 

Will not be coming back. There are many better restaurants in the area.
author: Tee K.

description: Historic not just the significance of how long this restaurant has been there but the recipes that mg to die for
author: M R.

description: The eggplant parmigiana missed the mark big time (eggplant wasn't breaded or fried, seemed like everything was warmed up in the microwave). The pesto wasn't bad.
author: Todd M.

description:
I loved that this is the oldest Italian restaurant in the US!!
We loved the food, I had Trenette Pesto..amazing!!
My husband had the Ravioli Zucca, a little rich for me but he loved it.
I highly recommend the brushetta salad...it was awesome!!
Fabian our server, made our evening!!  he was very attentive and super nice!!
We will definitely go back on our next visit!!
Thanks Fabian!!
author: Catherine C.

description:
Where Italian food is concerned, people have different likes and dislikes. It's not easy to keep everyone happy.  In my humble opinion that's why many of these TV programs featuring restaurant "makeovers" involve Italian restaurants.  I think that Italian chefs use recipes handed down for generations and have very personal touches.  If you order dish "A" in a place and order the same thing in another place, they may have the same core ingredients but the flavor palette may be entirely different.

I have a friend who thinks genuine "Italian" food starts and stops with spaghetti and meatballs.  The Fior D'Italia doesn't eschew those "American staples" but has enough variety to suit anyone and everyone.  I went there the other night for the first time since Chef Gianni took over the place and reopened (hence I'm treating this as a new review rather than an update).    Service was spot on attentive, bread hot and water glasses filled and coffee replenished.  I have absolutely no complaints whatsoever.  I was impressed by the fact that one of our party, a vegetarian, was able to get a "special" dish just by asking the waiter (Donny) politely if it was possible.  No problem.

I always read the bad reviews just to get a sense of how a place clicks.  I noticed many were because some coupons from a few years back aren't redeemable under the new owner.   I remember the old owner - a heck of a nice fellow but  prone to giving out coupons and free dinners (I had a free dinner there myself several years ago).  That may be patriotic or civic minded but it impacts negatively on the bottom line.  Personally I would never expect a coupon more than a year old to be honored and don't think anyone else should either.  Kudos to Chef Gianni for trying to make things right  with people that do try to use them.

I had a mixed green salad for starters and the saltimbocca (literally jumps in your mouth) for the main course.  The presentation was excellent and the taste was very exquisite.  This dish could be very bland in the hands of an unskilled chef but Gianni's kitchen did a outstanding job.  There were some potatoes and asparagus to complete the dish - not so much as to waste but definitely enough to satisfy.  My wife had the veal chop (Cotoletta alla Piemontese) and it was huge.  My companions had the vegetarian "special" and a chicken dish (Petto di Pollo) respectively.  I didn't sample any of their food but I noticed that very little if any was left on their respective plates.  I declined dessert but one of them ordered a chocolate gelato and let us have a taste.  If you like chocolate ice cream, you will love chocolate gelato.

The Ambiance was classy but comfortable and pleasant.  It's upscale but doesn't over do it.  Staff was attentive and friendly.  The food was hot, tasty and delicious.  The menu has been cut back from what it was but that's a good thing as it allows them to focus.  The bar seems to be a local neighborhood hangout.  I understand they serve finger food but I didn't try any so my  comments are based on my experience.  The menu is Northern "Italian" style with pasta, soup and salad courses  separate items on the menu.

For a special  treat and a wonderful meal, Fior D'Italia can't be beat.  Thanks Gianni!  I'll be back!
author: Robert H.

description:
During our recent trip to San Francisco, we decided to try out a restaurant close to our hotel and came across this little place. I'm giving this place 2 stars only because the servers were very friendly, however the food deserves 1 star. 

I got the Ravioli de Zucca, a pumpkin ravioli and My boyfriend the Tortellini alla pana, essentially chicken stuffed tortellini. The food came out fast, perhaps a little too fast. Made me instantly think freezer to microwave, yuck. My dish was incredibly bland, which surprised me since the description on the menu made it sound incredibly flavorful. The sauce had no flavor and the ravioli tasted like they had stuffed it with canned pumpkin purée, minus any flavoring or seasoning. My boyfriends dish was also bland, leaving him to season the heck out of it with the salt and pepper at our table. Needless to say, for about $16 bucks a plate I was expecting a lot more. It was a waste of money and a disappointment. 

If you're looking for a restaurant to explore in San Francisco, probably ask the locals and make sure to avoid this place, it's not worth the bill.
author: Jen L.

description: Omg - we so needed this, we were not hungry but needed some awesome SF Italian before heading back to Sac, Gio was more than amazing.,.,, such a great guy!
author: Stephen B.

description:
This might be a good place to eat if you don't order Italian.

I made the mistake of ordering lasagna.  It was overcooked, hard, tasteless and late (wish it would have been later).

The seafood salad was great; my partner had halibut, which was good.

But at the least the quality control is -- well, it's not there.  At most, they can't cook Italian.

This was a group luncheon, where they also forgot to serve the coffee.

Oh well.
author: Glenn P.

description:
I have been eating here for over 10 years and I don't live anywhere near San Francisco so that should tell you how much I love it!

Do your self a favor and avoid the tourist trap restaurants along pier 39 and go get some great Italian food. This is the place!
author: Smorga M.

description: Brought the family here when on Spring Break and staying in Telegraph Hill. Love the whole North Beach area. Great to just walk around and take it in. Fior d'Italia was nice. Old school ambiance. Food was very good. Help was friendly. Would definitely recommend it
author: David F.

description: White clam sauce linguini was amazing! Lasagna also very good. Portions were a bit small, but bread helped soak up the delicious sauces.
author: Brandon O.

description: We arrived later at night on Easter Sunday. The staff was very courteous and was happy to seat us even though we were a bit underdressed.  The pasta was very fresh and I had the pesto. It was excellent. If you like pasta pesto, this one is a winner. Service was fast, water always filled, bread kept coming (had to say no), and the bill was fair. Even got 10% off when the hotel we were staying at gave us a coupon.
author: David S.

description: My favorite local Italian place. Locals get a discount! The food is fresh and made with love. The chicken tortellini is to die for. The service is fantastic. The wine list is lovely. I've eaten here many times and even celebrated my birthday here last year - and it has always been fantastic!! I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone!
author: Kendell H.

description:
We held a private dinner party here in April for my company's Board of Directors meeting.  The folks at Fior d'Italia could not have been nicer or easier to work with!  They accommodated our group -- we were doing our dinner on a Wednesday night -- in the private Assisi Room so they would not be bothered by the live jazz during their dinner.  We pre-ordered appetizers so that they would be on the table when the guests arrived.

We walked to the restaurant from our hotel and we were taken back immediately to the private room.  We had two wonderful servers who greeted us right away, and the cold appetizers were already on the table.  Within minutes, they brought out the warm appetizers.  The wine selection was great, the food was wonderful, and the service was terrific.  All the directors returned from the restaurant and had rave reviews!  

This is also a great local neighborhood hangout -- saw lots of locals (and their dogs -- awesome) hanging out for the great happy hour.  We would recommend this and will definitely return when our business brings us back to the city!
author: Laurie M.

description:
My son and I had lunch here on October 9. It was the best meal we had during our stay in San Francisco. It was the day of the Italian Heritage Parade (aka Columbus Day) in North Beach. We were staying at a hotel near Chinatown and didn't even know there was a parade/festival scheduled that day (which was fantastically energetic and fun and ended up being one of my favorite experiences). For whatever reason my 16 year old was just determined to get to Fisherman's Wharf and not interested in the whole festival/parade experience going on in North Beach. Anyway, once we got to the Wharf I think he finally realized how touristy it was so he was more amenable to walking back through North Beach. We decided to go up Mason for a late lunch and found Fior d'Italia. We decided to dine outside and it was lovely. Michael, our server, was fantastic. It was pretty slow when we arrived, but within the next hour the outside tables became completely occupied. Having waited tables I know it can be a challenge when the restaurant gets busy but he handled everything admirably.

The food was perfect. Both my son and I adore linguine with clams; would have been more interesting for us to order different dishes but we both had to have the clams. Our Caesar salads came first; they were perfect. There is something about Caesar salad dressing that certain Italian restaurants that I'm always trying to recapture at home; I haven't been able to do it. It's definitely the anchovies but there's something more to it. The bread served at the table ... yum. Extremely fresh, very crusty on the outside with just the right amount of elasticity and chew on the inside. We broke the loaf off in pieces and dipped it into olive oil with a little balsamic. So simple, but with such good ingredients so yummy.

The pasta was a hit. The clams were served in the shell and the sauce was on point. I did think the clams were a bit on the small size, but it was a generous portion and the clams were very sweet. Perfectly seasoned.

After the meal Kyle ordered a cappuccino which was so pretty to look at it I was kinda sad he had to drink it! He said it was delicious. There was so much froth on it you could make a huge mustache with it if that's your thing.

The overall vibe of the place was a lot of fun. It's very tastefully appointed with tablecloths, heavy china, etc. but we weren't made to feel uncomfortable in our flip flops and casual dress. Their Sunday jazz ensemble started up while we were eating and it was a nice accompaniment. 

My only quibble is that when the bill arrived we were charged for the dinner price when we had ordered off the lunch menu. However, when I pointed this out to the manager he was very apologetic and rectified the bill immediately. I do think this was just a simple error and not an intentional effort to overcharge. Again, a shout out to Michael the waiter - polite and efficient - a l'il different from our Chinatown experiences (and I'm Chinese). Will definitely make a point of returning next time we're in town!
author: Renee N.

description:
I'm 100% Italian, grandmother from Naples... have eaten at the beat Italian spots in North Jersey, Brooklyn, South Florida, Kansas City, Vegas... This place is the best you can get. The real deal and service is impeccable. 

Get veal (chefs been making it for 30+ years), bread (made in house), pasta sampler with gnocchi marinara, pesto rigatoni, and stuffed alfredo tortellini.  Filet can be cut with a fork... literally. 

You cannot go wrong here if you know and crave Italian.
author: Dan B.

description:
Great little spot tucked away between Fishermen's wharf and North Beach. We too rarely visit to this part of town but were glad we did this weekend.

Fior d'Italia strikes a perfect balance between classy and casual without being pretentious.

The food is good and the price tags fair. We shared the barbecued prawns and each had a plate of pasta, topping everything off with a cannoli and chocolate mousse.

Also, the service is top-notch, i.e. quick, friendly and attentive. Great place for groups, even kids.
author: Teiki K.

description: I came here for an early dinner with a group and was seated quickly. The drinks and bread came quickly and we were able to get a few appetizers while we waited for the main course. All of the food was extremely delicious and I had a great time in the beautiful restaurant with it's friendly and courteous staff. My only criticisms would be that the prices were a bit much for what we got and that we waited a long time for our food because our waiter was apparently waiting for us to finish our appetizers.
author: Kevin S.

description: Fior d'Italia is an Italian throwback in time with plenty of old school charm.  Try to resist the urge to fact check if it is indeed the "oldest Italian restaurant in America".  You can do your research after you soak in the atmosphere and have your fill. No need to dress up even though the servers are.  Our server was awesome and kept the bread coming while we waiting for our entrees.  We kept the olive oil and balsamic vinegar flowing to keep the pace.  While the food was good and the environment quaint, we absolutely loved the live jazz music.  Even though you would think that live brass music would be loud, even the baby by the table was able to sleep through it.  Delizioso e caratteristico!
author: Darren K.

description:
Best happy hour in North Beach. Just wish the service could match the food...
We were in a table outside and they basically ignored us for very long periods of time. Had to come inside and call the servers attention several times, which wasn't very nice
author: Sara C.

description:
I live only 1 block away and I cant' believe I hadn't tried this place sooner.

I came here with my family and it's a very quaint and pretty restaurant. I liked that it wasn't loud and that I could have good conversation without having to yell, like other touristy restaurants in north beach.

To start, we got the pancetta wrapped prawns and the calamari. The prawns were AMAZING. Make sure to save some of the bread to dip in the garlic sauce afterwards!! The calamari was really good as well. It came with lemon and two different kind of sauces. Very fresh and very delicious.

For dinner, my mom and I split the Tagliatelle alla Bolognese and the Bucatini Amatriciana. Both dishes were superb. The  Tagliatelle alla Bolognese is a fresh house made pasta with a meat sauce. The pasta was perfectly a'dente and the meat sauce was great.  The Bucatini Amatriciana is a "dry" pasta (not housemade?) with pancetta in a spicy tomato sauce and it is soooooo good. I honestly couldn't decide which one I liked better because they were equally tasty. Also, the portions were huge- we had half of each pasta left to take home.

We topped our meal off with two bottles of wine.

Do yourself a favor and come to Fior D'Italia so I can say I told you so.

:)
author: Jordan S.

description: Love this place!  It's my dad's favorite Italian and its tradition to stop in at least twice when we are in town.
author: Melinda E.

description: Definitely our favorite SF Italian. Very traditional, just a very "warm atmosphere". Food is a 4+. Octavio is an extremely attentive waiter. Ask for him, and you can't go wrong! Great wines, at reasonable prices...and the best sourdough available anywhere!!
author: Dave D.

description: Nice classy feel and good location if you near Fisherman's Wharf.  I am not prone to offer a negative critique  - I often just don't write anything unless it was bad bad bad.  This was not bad, just not great.  The Burrata had a unique twinge to the tomato flavor - maybe a strong olive oil?  The pesce Del giorno (halibut) had a caper sauce that made it taste almost slimy.  The vegetables and potatoes were great but the fish lacked any real flavor and the slimy texture didn't help.  The double chocolate mousse was better but had maybe a hint of a liquor or something?  Everything was just slightly off...  No big failures at all.  Just not excellent.
author: El Jefe J.

description: Took my girlfriend for valentines dinner. The food was great as well as their service. I had made reservations for 830pm got there a bit early around 805pm and we were seated with no hesitation. The restaurant has a real romantic vibe perfect place to take that special someone out for a nice elegant dinner.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
First impressions are not everything.

Upon arrival we were greeted by the valet playing on his cell phone (a pet peeve of mine), I had to approach him to ask if he was indeed the valet for the restaurant. Things were not off to a great start, but changed quickly upon our entrance. The ambiance was elegant old school italian, the waiter was charming and knowledgable, and the food was great. I particularly enjoyed the antipasto appetizer, a special that included cantaloupe with prosciutto, and the tagliatelle bolognese (featuring perfectly al dente handmade pasta). In the end this felt like the classic sort of establishment that can never go out of style. I plan to return
author: Erik C.

description: From the minute we turned down the little alleyway I liked this place. The waiter's recommendations were great, the wine was excellent, and the outdoor seating has enough patio warmers to keep everyone warm.
author: Donald C.

description: Wednesday for an early evening dinner...six sibling reunion with family and friends. The staff was friendly and welcoming. We had a variety of appetizers, pasta, risotto, entrees, and dessert. The food was delicious! Mal Sharpe and the Big Money in Jazz Band was wonderful.  All in all, an excellent experience!
author: Maria L.

description: First and last time we go to this Italian restaurant. I ordered a pasta dish with mussels and didn't like the dish because it was too chewy and dry for my taste. Not even five minutes later the chef comes out and scolds us for not liking his dish and then said its our responsibility and not his. Absolutely worst restaurant experience in my life. The chef came out angry and told us off. Consider yourself warned if you order something and don't like it because you will get yelled at for it.
author: Jackie M.

description: This is a nice neighborhood restaurant with good food and great service.  The waiter was very accommodating, patient and helpful.  With three kids, trying to get everybody's order right can be a little challenging and he was definitely up to the task.  Our food came out fast,  the portions were large and the food very flavorful.  My tortellini was fantastic, my sons minestrone soup was full of vegetables and very tasty, my daughters chicken dish was excellent and my other daughters rigatoni and pesto sauce was also very tasty.  The price is what you would expect from a nice Italian restaurant but not over-the-top.  I would definitely return to this restaurant again if in the neighborhood.
author: Scott D.

description:
I would like to formally thank Fior D'Italia and their staff for helping me and my wife Nicole to have a beautiful wedding reception!! Lucio was helpful from the first time I called to brainstorm about using this establishment for my wedding reception. As an Italian-American I had high standards for the food & service of a Ristorante Italiano, and Fior did not disappoint. They stuck by their word, they were accommodating to the different foods, table seating, additions to the menu, music, and much more. We were treated liked family from Lucio and his staff from the moment we met, and the service was always first class. If you are planning a wedding reception or are just looking for a fine place to dine, this is definitely a wonderful place. The experience we had for our wedding will not be forgotten, and the staff here will always be like family.

Grazie mille Lucio & Fior D'Italia,

Joe & Nicole & il mio figlio Luciano...

Wedding Reception was September 27, 2014
Guest Total = 115
author: Joe R.

description:
I love this place! 

O.M.G! The homemade pasta is delicious!

I've tried the lasagne, loved it. Another time I had the ravioli and it was equally good.  One of my friends order the fettuccine alfredo and was also very good. Another friend order the linguine with clams, delicious. 

I like the location, is quiet, close enough to walk from Fisherman's Wharf, far enough from the touristy crowd. No dress code, but you have the option to be dressy since it looks all fancy (white tablecloths and all) 
The servers/bartenders are polite and friendly. (and cute!) 
Happy Hour?? (http://www.fior.com/happy_hour.html) yes please! =D 
I will be back for the Live Jazz on Wednesdays! (live music also on Sundays) 

DESERT! DESERT! DESERT! We tried like 4 different ones, all amazing! 

WINE WINE WINE (I'm on my 4th glass right now...yuuum!!)
author: Jessica E.

description: I was remiss. I should have reviewed this spot, when we first visited. a time whereby we enjoyed superb food, and excellent service. Holding on to that memory of a year ago, we returned to what we hoped would be another fine experience. After finishing up at the de Young, we arrived early, for the dinner hour. When you enter a nice restaurant, you anticipate the welcome. No one, was present at the front desk for--just a while too long. There were only a few of us seated. Yet, we had to wait much too long to receive the customary attention. Our server, though not young, did not demonstrate the skills of a seasoned server. He was quick to dash off, without attempting to guide us through the menu, or really listen to our questions. As with our previous experience, this time, the food was not memorable. Fortunately, the bread was still great. My husband had a white fish of the day, which was overall, good. I had seafood, which was average. The side vegetables were below average, especially the overly cooked and soggy potatoes. To finish, we ordered the crème caramel. What we received was basically a flan. We love flan, but not at an Italian restaurant. Also worth mentioning, during our first experience, we dined at night. The daylight, however, cast light on the need for updating  or refreshing this once, grand historical restaurant. For the price ($$$), better cuisine and service was in order. It's good to hear that some really enjoyed this spot. Based on the mixed reviews, I think a great experience can be hit or miss. We're still holding on to the lovely memory of that first dining experience!
author: BL L.

description: Found this place last minute looking for a spot to eat near cobbs comedy club since we had show tickets. They were friendly and accommodating. Love the old traditional Italian family style feel of this place. Ordered the veal scaloppine and it reminded me of my grandpa's (he used to own/run an Italian restaurant back in the day). If you're looking for good, traditional Italian dishes, this is the place.
