author: Tracy Y.

description: Fantastic dinner, absolutely plan to come back. We had the Ravioli di Zucca (fresh pumpkin with a lemony butter sauce and sage leaves, topped with pine nuts) and the Tortellini di Panna (chicken with a cream sauce, which came out light and very flavorful). Great service, and loved the atmosphere with old photos and menus from the restaurant over the course of its 140 year history.
author: Christopher L.

description:
WOW!! Never ever go here for Thanksgiving Dinner. Food was horrible. This was my parties first time going here and the waiter definitely recommended that we get the thanksgiving dinner which was 50 dollars per person. Worst decision! Had a group of seven and we each paid around 87 dollars (tip included because we had 7 people but definitely did not deserve tip). 

Food 1.5/5:
The food consisted of a halibut cake appetizer, pumpkin ravioli, turkey, and pumpkin pie. From reading the menu and reviews, I expected a better menu or more choices. However, our waiter told us that this was the food to get. 

The meal began with a big piece of bread. Who doesn't like bread? But the problem was they gave us a huge piece of bread and did not tend to our order until literally 45minutes later. By the time, I got my meal I was already half full from the bread. We asked our waiter on multiple occasions that we were ready to order. Around the 20minute mark we flagged him again but he said "No, you finish your bread and I will come back later." Although it was taken as a joke and their were really short laughs, he literally left our table and didn't take our order. We felt that this was very rude when we were hungry. Finally, after flagging him down again, he took our orders. 

The halibut cake was just a simple deep-fried fish dish. Nothing amazing, I rather order another appetizer than eat this. Very plain tasting.

Pumpkin Ravioli:
oh wow, never ate something so horrible in my life.  Basically ravioli with pumpkin filling. The taste was horrible. I love pumpkin but this seriously did not suit my taste. Basically eating pumpkin pie but worst because its in a ravioli dish. Literally, no one finished their 4 pieces of ravioli. 

Turkey meal:
Usually turkey is hard to cook so I will give them credit for making it edible. But nothing special. Just simple turkey with gravy. 

Pumpkin Pie:
Once again, just a simple pie you can buy at costco or make yourself.

Service 0/5:
As mention before, waiter was horrible. The waiter also did not know anything about their wine menu. We asked him which one he recommended. His answer was "they are all good." He also had to come back multiple times because he did not know which wine we ordered (almost gave us the 400 dollar wine). We also spent a total of 2.5 hours at the restaurant. Not because we were having a good time but because our food would not come out. Felt like Food hell. I was literally fighting to finish my food.

However, one thing to note is that we never tried their other food so this restaurant might actually be good but based upon our first experience, we will never go to this restaurant again.
author: Noah W.

description: Fior D'Italia was pretty good.  We ate at an odd time when the restaurant was virtually empty, so it was just a little awkward.  We had a reservation from OpenTable but I'm not sure they really acknowledged that I had a reservation since I obviously didn't need one - yet they initially tried to seat us at a table for 2 with plenty of 4-tops available.  We asked to move and they accommodated that pleasantly.  Service was pretty good (Israel).  Only one minor issue, which was handled really smoothly.  We had ordered the Caesar salad but they brought out the entrees before the salad.  No issue, thankfully, when we reminded our server about the salad, he made it right and when the entrees arrived, they were hot.  So no problem there at all, he just forgot.  The pancetta-wrapped shrimp appetizer was excellent. There was even a slight char (which I liked a lot) on the outside.  The shrimp were large and flavorful and fresh. The sauce was really good too, we used it with the bread, which I also thought was excellent, soft on the inside and a nice crust on the outside.  Plenty of oil and balsamic if you are interested, on the table.  Caesar salad was ok not great, but not bad.  I got the Paglia e Fieno con Fieslli, which was outstanding.  Really nice creamy tomato sauce, and really fresh tasting pasta.  Nice peas, too.  I actually finished it, which I don't do that often with pasta dishes.  My wife got the Tagliatelle Bolognese, which was very good in flavor, just a tad off in texture but overall very good (she thought it was just a little on the dry side).  Really a minor thing, and overall a nice restaurant, roomy and quiet, great fresh pasta, and good service.
author: Michael P.

description:
WOW!  Lived in the city for 8 years and just discovered this place.  Felt like I stepped into old NYC and this alone had me sold.  Perfect Italian background music!  Was on my way to Cobbs Comedy (incredible) and wanted to grab a bite and a vino.  JACKPOT!!  Ambience galore, excellent wine list and great menu.  One of the best Caesar Salads I have ever had.  I don't eat meat and that usually limits the menu - not here!
Dined at the bar as a solo and noticed several locals doing the same.  A couple of TV screens available if you want to keep up on the local teams - who doesn't?  The restaurant is beautiful and has adorable outside tables.  Part of a quaint hotel which adds to the lovely ambience and adds charm!   LOVE this place and can't wait to go back!  Super friendly shorter guy behind the bar whose name I didn't catch greeted and bid farewell to his guests with a warm hug in true Italian style!  One of the BEST in North Beach!!!
author: Lynne P.

description:
Decided to give this restaurant a try after reading reviews here. My impressions upon leaving the restaurant are the following: the food is just 
okay, nothing special here. If you prefer a more lively atmosphere I would 
not suggest dining here. My dish ( risotto ) was under cooked and bland. 
My girlfriend ordered penne but got ziti. The bread was very good but I had to ask the waiter for butter, strange. There are better restaurants to choose from in the area and I'd suggest personally stopping by rather then just reading the reviews on Yelp exclusively.
author: Ralph E.

description:
My wife and I had our first date at the Hotel San Remo 31 years ago. We drove by to show our now adult kids "where it all began". We pulled up and saw that Fior D'Italia had relocated where the old restaurant had been. I had enjoyed Fior years ago at it's original location near St Peter and Paul church. So we had an early dinner with other tourists in shorts and sweatshirts. I was surprised there were about six or eight groups eating at 5:30 pm. 

I had the osso bucco which was done perfectly. My wife had the chicken with prosciutto that was delicious. The meat sauce was as close to my homemade as I have had since Patsy's in Manhattan. 

  My only criticism was the meatballs my daughter had. It may be authentic or their preference but it in my opinion. It was over seasoned with (I think) sage. It was just too strong a flavor for all of us (we all tasted it). In fairness to them we didn't complain. We had plenty to eat. 

Peaceful location between North Beach chaos and Fisherman's wharf. 

Surprised valet parking was around $10.
author: Dave D.

description:
Upon the recommendation of my grandparents, my husband and I had dinner here during our first visit to SFO. Given that my grandparents had held onto the business card from their visit 15+ years ago, I had high hopes. And they were met. The food was excellent, particularly the chicken tortellini my husband had. We also really liked the still steaming bread that was served while we waited for the entree. 
What I was particularly impressed with was how the host treated us. We wandered in off the street, not dressed fancy in the least, and the host was extra engaged with us, when I expected the opposite. He stopped by multiple times, and was very friendly and engaging. We will certainly recommend this to other friends and family who visit the city.
author: Holly H.

description: I didn't like it! I didn't like the taste, though they were quite obliging to accept in making pastas and appetizers which we want.
author: Divya D.

description:
Great to place for a Upscale  Quiet lunch.  Great menu.
Excellent food. The Monte Christos are super.
author: P S.

description:
My husband took me to dinner here for my birthday. This place is class A service!
Our waitress, Chelsea, was fantastic! She was very attentive to our needs and made excellent recommendations for our entrée choices. We had the Osso Buco, Rack of Lamb, Risotto alla Milanese and shared oysters and caesar salad. Everything was fantastic! Chelsea surprised us by belting out Happy Birthday in Italian Opera style! WOW! Amazing! Thank you for a wonderful dining experience and we will be back!
author: Shireen V.

description: It was terrible service and the food was cold. Our wine came out 30 mins after we ordered it and 2 people in my family had cold food. My food also made me sick after. Our waiter also never came to serve and check on us. It was terrible.
author: Cathy F.

description: Came here for dinner last night. We're Bay Area natives, but had never been to this hidden gem. Loved the cozy ambiance and decor of this family style restaurant. The pasta dish I tried was very good and my boyfriend loved his lamb chops. The homemade bread was a great touch! We would definitely come back here.
author: Nicola L.

description: I don't know where to start with this review.   We came here for our friends birthday party.  First of all, the service was instantly TOP NOTCH.   The server was attentive to us and didn't once have us waiting on anything.   Now the food was on a whole other level of AMAZING.   WOW WOW WOW.  EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS.  We ordered a variety of food and everyone in our party all repeated the same word "yummmmmmm"  Thank you for an awesome time.  We will be back for sure.
author: Venice Y.

description:
Not far from Sheraton Hotel, we tried this place on the account that we had a 10% coupon.  Decor was upscale and clean.  Service was ok, but their pasta was something I can't get enough of.  It's a traditional Italian restaurant where they make their own pasta and it's cooked al dente (cooked to the firm bite).  We ordered the fruit with prosciutto as appetizer to start and shared that among 4 people.  Nice and light.  I ordered the bolognese with meat sauce for my main dish. It was very simple dish, but so delicious.  What an experience to try this place!
I gave it 4 stars because I think our server could be a little more hospitable and friendly especially since it's kind of an upscale restaurant.
author: Virginia N.

description:
This was a walk by decision.  Nothing to complain about.  Our server and the staff were all very nice, professional and attentive.  My wife and I both had pasta dishes and both were tasty, good size portions and well prepared.

We did have cocktails and they were a generous pour.  

Relaxing and delightful atmosphere.  I don't think I would make a special trip in San Francisco, but I would go back if in the area.
author: Drew M.

description:
I sadly had to update my review. I have been coming here for 3 years and I really love the bartenders. My family and I have spent a lot of money in here. 
The owner is always around and has never once said hi or remotely greeted me. He is the type of person to charge me 3 dollars for a slice of bread with my meal, when it's usually free. He also likes to hover around to make me feel uncomfortable, and stare. 
I knocked it down to 2 stars because being in the hospitality industry for 13 years, being respectful and good service for your customers is top priority. I am your guest.
I may update this later when I feel less insulted. 
It's clear I'm not the crowd he typically prefers.
Maybe I'll come around again when I'm 75 and he will respect me? Lol
author: Kristina P.

description:
Recently had dinner at the Fior D'Italia after a 50-year hiatus. Much has changed, of course, including the ownership. The food was very good, the service better. San Francisco has several Italian restaurants; a few are better and more expensive than the Fior D'Italia. Most are derivative. The five people in our party each had different entrees, and all enjoyed their meals. My rustic grandniece had rabbit and pronounced it excellent. Rabbit, for cry in' out loud! Poor wee critter.

A few Yelpers here said the staff was rude. Not my experience at all. I was greeted like an old friend. Everything was served promptly and courteously. On the not so wonderful side was the Wednesday jazz in the dining room. The music was enjoyable, but it made having a table conversation difficult. Go another day.
author: Jay C.

description:
Excellent food, excellent service. True authentic Italian food. The best bread!!!
Great prices, great house wine. What more could you want!!!
author: Kristy G.

description: Live in the neighborhood. Had walked by many times. Invited a ladyfriend to have lunch. Everything was wonderful from the time we arrived until departing. The waiter was top-notch. The Caesar salad with anchovies was the best. The sole was perfect. Panna cotta excellent. Even the coffee was great. My new favorite restaurant!  Nancy M
author: Nancy M.

description:
On holiday in San Francisco and went here based on recommendations and we were not disappointed. Lucked out with live music on a Wednesday night. Service was excellent. We never felt rushed and the waiter anticipated our every need. After dinner we sat and enjoyed the music. 

We had oysters and kalamari for appetizers. Both were good, the kalamari portion was huge. Followed with fresh pasta which was also delicious. The wine list is not huge but still a good selection with a number of good Italien wines. Finished off with an excellent espresso.
author: Flemming A.

description: Great food, wonderful atmosphere and terrific service.  What more could you ask for?  We took the Powell St. streetcar, the restaurant is a short 10 minute walk from the trolley.  The food is wonderful.  The menu is very versatile ranging from pastas with red/white sauces to creative and exceptional seafood dishes.  They offer a good wine selection which is not overpriced.  When my wife and I can enjoy a fine dining experience with a couple of glasses of wine and walk out for under $100 I call that a win-win.
author: David A.

description: I went for lunch with my wife and some friends. I was told a few of the reviews mentioned that they had excellent Osso Buco. Problem was that's only offered for dinner my bad for not confirming and looking at the menu myself. I ended up having a burger, which wasn't really all that good. Having a burger at an Italian joint is probably some sort of crime and I'm just having to pay for my crime by having to eat a bad burger. My wife had the Monte Cristo and it sounds like it was slightly better (maybe three star). It was still a disappointment considering all the good Italian Restaurants in the area. I won't feel the need to go back. Cafe Macaroni still remains my favorite in the area even with the funny name.
author: Scott L.

description: Had linguini tutto mare. Nothing special. Mussels were gritty. Bread was cold and seemed like not fully defrosted. Service was very good though so this saved the evening for me. Cheese plate was also just so-so. Cheese selection could've been better. Espresso was good. Jazz band was excellent. An additional star for that.
author: Hama L.

description: First time eating here at the oldest Italian restaurant in the country. Is that truely possible? Calamari was okay certainly not the best, but the rest of my meal was delicious. Elegant dining but still comfortably relaxed. Waiter did seem a little unorganized considering we were the only ones there. Long delays in bringing drinks, condiments, etc. But still all very pleasant. Great looking bar
author: Matt A.

description: Happy Hour is beyond belief. Fabulous martini's & great appetizers 50%. The bartender Gio, makes a very good, I mean a very good drink. We had a great time at this SF institution.
author: Sandra L.

description: This place was fantastic on my last trip to SF! I recommend the pepper shrimp pizza and a red glass of wine to start. And then any pasta will do! The noodles are so chewy too. Our dinner was perfect. I also recommend getting a reservation, cause it was very busy for dinner on Monday night :)
author: Tiff M.

description: Great Italian Restaurant! The portions are huge.  I split my pasta with my husband and still looked like i had a full plate!  The calamari was bomb.  I would pass on the escargot here.  It doesn't even come in a shell.  Seafood linguine was really good.  I had a bite of a friend's lasagna and that was great too! This is considered one of the oldest restaurants in America (changed ownership 4 times)!  Come check it out!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Food was good, but not for the price. I had the steak, it was sadly a bit tough, the cream peppercorns sauce saved it.
author: Curtis M.

description:
3.5 stars. 

I swear I've seen this restaurant on TV but can't recall which.  The bar area was crowded with some regulars and the bartender was quick and friendly.  Our group was seated in the main dining and for a bit it was just our group with a couple smaller parties that would trickle in and out.  Service was attentive considering it wasn't that busy (but hey it was a Tuesday what do you expect).  We ordered a few appetizers to share with a few bottles of wine.  I wanted to try a few things that I heard great reviews about so our waiter was fantastic to accommodate - got a small plate of pasta with gnocchi, ravioli and a pesto pasta.  All delicious! I was able to sneak a few bites of lamb shank and potatoes which was tasty as well.  Dessert was ok- had a tiramisu mousse type thing but still tasty to finish off the night.
author: Julie F.

description:
So delicious and great atmosphere! The staff is very friendly and made us feel welcome the moment we walked in. The food is some of the best Italian my husband or I have had. 
They serve delicious warm ciabatta bread while you wait. We tried the Caesar salad, Tortellini, and Gnocchi for dinner, loved it all. We asked for a scoop of their vanilla gelato with a shot of espresso, and poured it over the gelato. So incredible! Their cannoli was also very good. 
Highly recommend it here. They've been here since 1886. Our server Octavio was really great too. 
We will definitely be back.
author: Noelle R.

description:
I bought a coupon from Halfoff.TV and drove out to this restaurant from Fremont on a Monday night. The staff was very friendly and the food was good. The first thing that kinda through me off was when they served the bread I asked for some garlic to put in my olive oil for dipping and he said I could not have any because it would insult the chef. Which I thought it was a little strange when it is only for dipping. Then when my seafood pasta came out we asked for Parmesan cheese he said we could not have any. I have never been refused either of those items at any Italian restaurant I have been to. We then had desert which was the Tiramisu and a pudding with fruit on top. The desert was delicious. 

   Then our check came. I gave the sever my coupon. He looked at it and said that I could not use it. I was very upset about it so he took it to the manager to see if I could use it. He came back with the manager and the manager said that he does not have to take because that they changed ownership. So we went around and around about this coupon. He told me that he would give me a little off my bill. I said whatever and do what you gotta due with a pissed off attitude from me. He then came back and gave me a better discount which made me a little happier. It was a little to much drama over this coupon that should have never happen. It was a Monday night and there was mane a quarter filled up. I explained to the manager that he should be happy that people are coming in to use there coupon because it brings in business that you would normally have. I think it is a great promotion idea from the previous owner. The coupon was good only from Monday through Thursday for food only.My advise to people that have this coupon is to not even waste your time and try to use it there unless you want to battle with the manager. Like I said , other then the drama that happened , the food and the service was good.I would have rated it a 3.5.
author: Daniel J.

description: I've been here a couple of times over the past year or two, both in small groups and once with a large group.  The food here is delicious!  I've ordered different items each time and was not disappointed.  I especially liked their tomato and mozzarella appetizer.  The service was attentive.  It's right in between North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf, so a great location.  This is a classic Italian place that is not to be missed!
author: Sheryl S.

description: I moved to the west coast earlier this year from the east coast and because I live in the Central Valley I haven't had good Italian in a long time. We are on a family trip and after eating at a below average Italian lunch place I was determined to find another Italian place tonight. This place has is authentic and we loved the place. The music, the atmosphere, the service, and the food were all top notch. My wife got the the pesto pasta and that it was actually brought my score from a 5 to a 4. I ordered the linguine seafood dish with a light red sauce and it was a healthy serving and reasonably priced. Highly recommend this place if you're in the fisherman wharf area.
author: Chris R.

description:
My bf and I were looking for a place to eat near by. We yelped a place near by and saw that Fior D'italia was open until 10 pm.

We walked at 9:20.

First of all..no one was at the front.. we just waited until someone show up

The servers did not seem happy to see us since we were walking in close to closing time; no one even greeted us. We felt like we were unwanted.. but whatevers.. we were so hungry, we just ignored it. We got seated and quickly ordered their lasagna and pesto pasta. We literally finished in less than 20 minutes since we were starving [wasn't even 10pm!]

Our server's mood brightened up; he was much nicer in the end as he cleaned up our plates. He made a joke, saying that he will see us tomorrow and dont be late.

The bf was not happy. Wouldn't come here again
author: Eunice K.

description: Service is extremely unprofessional. We had a large group of people and the waiter was unable to split the bill between cards. Later on manager came and said they splitting the bill would be too much work and take about and hour. Waiter  and manager seems like they can really can less about providing quality service.
author: Irene A.

description: Fresh made pasta, bread right from the oven, great service, attention to detail. Well done!
author: Brian A.

description: Entrees were excellent. We had the Seafood Linguini and the Prawns. Service was fast and polite. Great place!
author: Richard F.

description:
My family and I had decided to try Fior DItalia tonight for my moms birthday and from the moment we arrived at the door, we were given the best attention and care that most guests ask for, but never get from other restaurants. The Fior team was attentive, enthusiastic, and on point throughout our whole stay, which added to the amazing food we served this evening. I almost feel bad to say that I expectations, but I feel even better knowing that those expectations were met and exceeded. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Fior DItalia to anyone interested in a great night!
Much love to Lalo who guided us through the experience!
author: Jessie A.

description:
We always come to Fior DÍtalia for our special family gathering.  We had our lunch reception after our Wedding here back in Sept 16, 2008.  They treated me and my spouse really special as well as the whole family.

We even had the pleasure of the manager that day join our special celebration and gave us a bottle of wine; which is special for a group of Italians (and me, Italian through osmosis ...lol).

We love Fior DÍtalia!

Ciao...
author: Mary Carmel B.

description:
Excellent food and it is off the beaten path outside of the normal tourist restaurants.

The gnocchi and the pumpkin filled ravioli were great and the dessert was amazing. Try the cream caramel.
author: David S.

description: If you are looking for some authentic Italian meals this place has it! Great wines, apps and homemade pasta!  Our server has been working at this restaurant for 15 years and was extremely helpful and knowledgeable of every item on the menu. We were on our way to another restaurant and canceled our reservations to go here!!!
author: ReMax Kim A.

description:
Nice. Felt pretty italian and upscale. Somewhere in between italian district and fishermans wharf so not perfect location, but close enough that I walked from the Wharf. 

The atmosphere was great and the food was good, though my pesto was a little more "creamy" that I would have expected for authenticity's sake. But in America you can't expect perfect Italian. 

Aside from that my wait service was a bit slow, but on observation i felt everybody else had extremely attentive and friendly staff. 4
author: John G.

description: Bar Review, Saturday Night: For a longstanding, traditional North Beach spot, the young bartender had a positive attitude, caring service and great mixing with care. The room looks great, too - clean and well-restored. Keep it going!
author: Eddie B.

description:
It was my wife's birthday and I wanted to take her someplace different. I saw Fior D' Italian on a food program looked at the menu and we gave it a try. 
We made reservation and were promptly greeted and seated when we arrived. The decor is something you would expect for a hotel restaurant of that vintage. We decided to bring our own wine since it was one of our favorites I expected them to decant the wine but they did not.
 We ordered the Calamari. It came out hot and crisp as we like it the dipping sauces were good just not enough of them.
We ordered ceaser salads which seem to take a long time to get to the table. There were 4 things that went wrong with this course. The salads were much overdressed to the point of making them soggy: The Parmesan cheese was grated instead of shaved or shredded like most restaurants; the croutons were almost nonexistent and we were not offered and fresh ground black pepper. I thought that maybe they did not have the pepper but I saw our same severer offer it to the table next to us.
The salad cost $8 romaine lettuce is cheap. They need to step it up and offer a better product.
We ordered our entrees. My wife ordered the Tutto Mare which comes with a red sauce she asked if they could change it to a white wine garlic sauce .There was no issue with this and she was happy with the dish overall. 
I wish I could have said the same about my dish. I ordered the Tagliatelle with Bolognese sauce. This was supposed to be fresh pasta. I could not tell since it was in a big ball on plate the covered with some very plain tasting sauce. After the first bite I sent it back and ordered the ravioli with the same sauce equally unexciting. I was hungry so I ate.
The bright spot was they brought my wife a dish of Tiramisu. I know it is San Francisco and it cost a bit more to eat out but I expect and bit better.
BTW- After spending over 100.00 there was no one at the hostess stand to say goodbye or ask us was everything OK.The guy who seated us(Lolo) was setting at the bar feeding his face.
author: Al S.

description: Busy thanksgiving night.  Waiter was polite but average.  Food was mixed.  Osso buco was tasty and fall off the bone tender.  Parmigiana di Melanzane (eggplant) was bland.  Tagliatelle alla bolognese seemed overly dry.  Calamari appetizer was excellent.  Ambiance festive.
author: Kailua N.

description: Very disappointed today about a meal at this place. I ordered the fish of the day. "Sea bass". The piece of fish was very, very  small and tasteless, came with 3 small potatoes, 1 small slice of carrot and few green beens for the price of $37.00 + tax + tip. Ridiculous price! I am not going back!! Ever!!! ever!!!
author: Joe V.

description:
We saw this restaurant featured on a tv show and were excited to visit - especially in light that is has a tremendous amount of history and that the pasta is home-made. 

The folks who own the restaurant are missing a huge opportunity here - no one bothered to mention anything about the restaurants history!

The food was very good but the waiter seemed very disinterested in serving anyone while we were there.
author: Todd E.

description: Classically bad service.I almost couldn't believe it .We went there early New Years Day, not too many people in there at that hour.We ordered our food, (the only order they had in 10 minutes), it took a real long  time to get it,when we got it it was cold.Our waiter was so off the ball, we asked for water, he sat it on the table next to us, then disappeared for 10 minutes.  I asked for some cheese for my dish, I was half done before he returned. We told him  about our food being cold,he took no responsibility, handed us off to the manager.The Manager said, "you ate it, what do you want me to do about it now?"  Didn't offer to comp us with a coffee or cheesecake or something. He basically blew us off. I've been going to this place since the 70"s when it was across from Washington Square. It was expensive back then, but at least you got good service.I'll never go back.
author: Don B.

description:
Just got into town. This place is charming.  The chicken with prosciutto and fontina cheese was delicious.  
As we were walking in another Patron was leaving and said he was in restaurant business.  And that this place was delicious and reasonably priced. He was right.  Waiter was very friendly and professional  I would come back.
author: Greg C.

description:
My husband and I love coming to Fior D'Italia. It's near our apt so we like coming here on lazy Sunday nights when we don't feel like cooking. It's all about the HAPPY HOUR! Every day from 4-7pm. The food menu is just OK. I feel like the portions are very small (making up for the small price) and I haven't found anything that is as delicous as the full-priced pastas. But it's all about the HALF OFF drinks! All beer, wine, and cocktails are half off. Including top shelf alcohol.

FOOD:
They have many homemade pastas. My favorite is the pesto pasta. A nice al dente pasta with a very good pesto sauce. 

DRINKS:
Again, come here for happy hour to get half off drinks.

SERVICE:
We love coming here and are always welcomed with open arms and often a hug from Gio (one of the bartenders/servers). The rest of the staff are always super nice and friendly too. I love that they are in nice black pants, white shirt, vests, aprons, etc. Very classy.

This is the oldest Italian restaurant in the city (though not the original location). I love the old school ambiance here.
author: Laura A.

description: The food was so amazing and fresh! From the bread they start with to the amazing pasta dishes. I had the gnocchi and it was to die for. Definitely recommend and will go back. To boot they had live jazz to make the evening perfecto!
author: Jessica B.

description: Chef Gianni showed me how to eat the marrow in my veal shank and recommended the pan a cotta that was delicious
author: Nick G.

description: Very good! I don't get the low reviews on here. I thought that this place was wonderful. The wait staff was very nice and they happily accommodated my special requests of the food. Delicious Italian food and great service. I would definitely go back the next time I'm in North Beach. The pasta was fresh and delightful, and the whole interior was pretty. Clean bathroom. Very good place to go for Italian.
author: Jenny K.

description: Short and sweet. . . We were in need if a nice restaurant and we weren't hopeful looking nearby...then we saw this restaurant and gave it a shot.  It was soooooooooo good!  I'm a vegetarian so they made me a very yummy veggie pasta and my two girlfriends are carnivores and they loved their entrees as well.  I want to go back when I'm in the neighborhood just to get that veggie pasta again!
author: Shirin T.

description: best food in san francisco ,fresh,delicious ,good music,good service.i had the fish of the day,i don't know which fish it was but it was perfect.My husband had a burrata,it was melting in the mounth.i definitely recommend
author: Ayse S.

description: Great service.  Nice place for a special meal with a special someone.  Be ready to drop a penny. Food is above average.
author: Victor R.

description: Seriously?    Charging $4 for BREAD?  A meal at the bar - no bread. We thought it had just slipped the bartender's mind, as the service was not attentive -but he looked up from washing his glasses long enough for us to order bread.  He grabbed the bill and charged the bread before delivering it. Last time for us at this formerly fine SF establishment. Too bad.
author: Annette B.

description:
I thought this place would be more packed after appearing on TV, but San Franciscans aren't stupid. Our cab driver didn't even know where it was. On our way to this restaurant we passed a trattoria, and our cab driver assured us that they are the best italian in San Francisco, he was right. 

.
Bad service, enough said.

Pros: The frog legs are pretty good.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Service was good! The portions were ridiculous small for the price. Told the waiter he sent the owner over, an older guy came over and said that is the portion. I explained to him I'm in The restaurant business and it's ridiculous to serve two small pieces for that amount. Server told me they have multiple problems with this. Owner needs to retire he is out of touch.  

-Don Alonzo (dined here one Jan 20 2014)
author: Gabby G.

description:
Fun little Italian place with good Italian food and friendly (almost comically stereotypical?) service. These guys nearly fell over themselves to seat us. They were genuinely happy to have us as customers.  The staff there were clearly REAL Italians and the food was what I consider to be traditional but well done Italian, not fusion. Big groups in there for birthdays and bachelor parties - so noise level was high and raucous. Bread was delicious. They give you one piece at a time - which actually works because I would have eaten more. I am vegetarian and so my choices were a gnocchi (I was hoping to dave myself for dessert), a couple risottos, a polenta, salads or the vegetable of the day. I opted for the vegetable of the day. The waiter seemed utterly perplexed. Just the vegetables? But I was saving myself for cannoli. Which was very good and very traditional. Which means rich and good with the citron in the recipe. Wine selection good. Mural on the wall was hysterical and oh-so-Italian (my mother is Italian and she LOVES murals...and fake plants and columns...I digress.)  I would go back and I would be very happy there trying the other vegetarian dishes. 

Wait. Maybe I'd try the gnocchi. I'd have to eat an apple for lunch. 

Prices were pretty well SF standard. (You are not buying McDonald's !!) easily walked from the wharf. Easy location. Interesting neighborhood.
author: Barbara C.

description: I ate here with 4 friends on a Sunday after our first two choices were closed. When we arrived, the place was less than half full. Our waiter was very slow, inattentive, and spent a good portion of his time talking with the other workers. When we asked to split the check, he gave us an attitude and we asked the manager to do it instead. The manager was a nice guy, but the service of the one waiter just left a bad taste in my mouth and turned a 1 hour meal into a restless 2 hour meal. The food was alright; never coming back to this place.
author: Ixia J.

description: Very good food. Nice ambiance, excellent service. Traditional decor.
author: Aleks G.

description:
As an Italian American, it pains me to write this review.
My wife and I were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary so we looked long and hard to find just the right restaurant to eat at for this very special evening.  I advised the restaurant when I made the reservations about our anniversary and requested that if there were anything they could do to make this as special an evening as our marriage has been, we'd really appreciate it.  
Apparently they didn't get the message....  :-(
We were seated at a small 2 top directly against a wall near the back next to a long table of a dozen people that included at least 4-5 children running around the table and making a LOT of noise for a white linen restaurant.  The noise of the kids made others in the room have to raise their voices to be heard which created as loud an eating experience as we've ever had.  
The noise isn't what I'm upset about...it's the fact that we were sat directly next to them when there were plenty of other tables available and this was supposed to be our romantic anniversary dinner.
The rest of our evening WAS in the control of the staff and it was terrible.  The main source of our problem was the waiter: A young, dark haired man with a small ponytail/man-bun (there was only one so there should be no issue with the owners knowing who I'm referring to).
He came by to get our drink order, then came back with the drink to ask if we were ready to order.  I said I was not.  He then explained that they were out of quite a few items on their menu....then asked again what we wanted with a very rushed look on his face (as in "hurry up and order").  My wife definitely felt pressured to and ordered lasagna....I ordered veal scallopini.  
A waiter came by and dropped a piece of bread on our plates.  I was interested in getting butter to go with it....so I waited and waited to have any member of the staff come near us so I could ask for butter but NO ONE came by until they dropped off our dinners.
Our man bun waiter NEVER came back....until he dropped off the bill.  We saw the maître d across the room rip him a new one for screwing up someone's order which gave us a good idea why we weren't getting ANY service.
We finished eating and pushed our plates to the middle of the table and waited.....and waited.....and waited..  The maître d was happy to hob nob with a table of 3 older ladies several times and definitely looked our way but never recognized that we were done.  It literally took about 15 minutes for another older staff member in what looked to be a chef's jacket to stop by (the only person to stop by for 45 minutes) to ask if we were done.  
Keep in mind....this is now about 8:30 on a Monday night so the place was about 1/2 empty.  We felt absolutely ignored on what was supposed to be a very special anniversary evening.
We turned down dessert/coffee......at this point it was a nightmare evening that we wanted to have end as quickly as possible.  
We let the maître d know when we left how embarrassed we were for them for the service they provided and he was apologetic....but at that point, there was no saving our anniversary.  
The food was seriously average.  The lasagna was basic lasagna in a cheesy/saucy soup.  My veal was fine but for almost $40, the portion was miniscule.  Literally about 4 ozs of meat with (no kidding) about $0.25 worth of vegetables (1 potato, 1/4 of a carrot, several green beans).  

We were so incredibly disappointed.  I had researched dozens of restaurants for our special night before choosing this one.  We were dressed to the nines and ready for a wonderful experience.  The fact that my hat and coat had to hang on a hanger on a post in the middle of the restaurant across the room right above a table should have been our first indication that this place wasn't as great as folks were saying it was.

The bottom line for us was the absolute lack of ANY service. If you're going to charge that much and consider yourself to be a top notch Italian restaurant in SF, the only thing you have to distinguish yourself from other like-establishments is your service.  When the best thing about your night was the Uber ride, you chose the wrong place.

Gli italiani devono essere trattati meglio
author: R M.

description:
I was so excited to go on my date here. It's one of those places I've passed a million times, but for some odd reason, never went in. 

Last night upon arriving we were instantly sucked in to the fun vibe of the bar area. Everyone was glued to the tv as some guy was tight rope walking across the Grand Canyon. Hilariously bad jokes were made, but the staff and patrons were all in on it for good natured fun. 

We then got our table on the restaurant side. They let us choose from a window seat or booth. We loved we had the choice and opted for the booth. 

There are fresh cut roses on every table. That was a nice touch. 

Our waiter was super friendly and walked us through the different dishes and sauces as they have a bunch of appetizers and entrees I wasn't familiar with. 

We got the roasted peppers with anchovy cream sauce, shared a mixed green salad, bf got lasagna and I had the beef bolognese pasta. It was all delicious and fresh. The portions were generous too--we had plenty to take home. 

The timing of the meal was perfect too. Glad we did date night here with howaboutwe idea as we will definitely come back as we are most pleasantly surprised at the charm of the restaurant and the fun nature of the bar area. It caters to both casual and elegant dining.
author: Desiree P.

description: The food was amazing (Osso buco) but while our server was nice enough, he seemed too busy to be bothered with us :/
author: Lisa B.

description: My wife and I stumbled across this Italian restaurant after a long day of winery touring. Come to find out it's the oldest Italian restaurant in American! It has that old world vibe to it. The food was great and I definitely would recommend getting the homemade pasta.
author: Mike V.

description: Staff was real friendly.  Band was playing. Food was decent but probably not 4 stars.  A bit too smokey perhaps because of the bar.
author: Aaron C.

description: Enjoyed a great dinner here. I had some of the best prawns i've ever tried.  Also had a great seafood pasta. Service is excellent too. Good value for money in this price range. I would recommend.
author: Timothy K.

description:
Amazing old-fashioned SF style restaurant with great character!

The bartender was great and accommodating in changing our order for us when some of our group left, and the drinks were great as well. The chef and owners regularly walk around the restaurant and meet the customers, and the guy even speaks Italian!! 

Ravioli off the happy hour menu was good, get the clams as well.
author: Justin S.

description: Claimed to have gluten free pasta ( I have celiac ), and I can assure you that is not the case. Very very disappointing!
author: Lynda S.

description: A winner outside of the Wharf area. Lots of menu choices, tasty dinners, attentive servers, reasonable prices.
author: Oliver V.

description:
Good food.
My only gripe is that the bus boy set a water pitcher on a fresh side dish (plate) when cleaning a nearby table.
Otherwise a nice place.
author: Steve P.

description: Fantastic service,  fantastic food. My wife and I now dub this our go to Italian place for guest visits and date night. The lasagna, ravioli and calamari are our favorites!
author: Scott D.

description:
I brought my family (visiting California) here for lunch on a weekend - there was no one in there!  The decor was very nice, made me fear for much higher prices than we found (though it was lunch). 

The food is very good - relatively authentic, rather than Olive Garden-style Americanized-Italian.  I had the pumpkin ravioli, and they were excellent.  The lunch servings were a good size; our plates were empty at the end, but we didn't leave hungry.

My family was very impressed by this place - while they ate at other Italian places while in California, they said this was the best meal they had and a highlight of the trip.
author: Nicole A.

description: First time here. Very authentic   Italian food. I had the fresh Ravioli which was excellent . A definite must if you are seeking true Italian food.
author: John K.

description: Cozy classic Italian environment! Greeted warmly by the staff with no wait for a table and a full restaurant late Saturday night. Fresh house made pasta! Classic meat lasagna reminiscent of your best friends grandmas fresh out of the oven on a Sunday evening. Enjoyed the house wines and the overall experience!
author: Raul L.

description: We looked for a restaurant that would accommodate a large party in a private room. Fior d'Italia was so responsive and met our needs perfectly. We had a completely private room for almost 20 people. The staff was attentive and every plate came out hot and at the same time. Conversation died as the meal began. The food was that good. Every plate was empty. No take-home boxes required. We had chicken parm, mussels, fettucine alfredo, fish of the day, and more. It was so delicious. Full bar and great wine. It was a wonderful time. We will return here every time we are in San Francisco.
author: Jenny Q.

description:
Tried to eat at Fior d'Italia at the end of December... we had a gift certificate purchased for half off about 2 years ago, which said that it never expired (but could only be used Mon through Thurs)

We finally got a chance to go into the city on a weeknight, and made a reservation at Fior d'Italia. When we got there, the place was practically empty. 

No wonder. The service is awul. As soon as we sat, the first thing the waiter said to me is "you look tired" -- wow, thanks for the compliment, buddy! (I should have replied with: "You look like a 60 year old man waiting tables in an empty overpriced restaurant.")

Since I had already spent $25 to eat at this place, I let them know about the coupon/certificate before we ordered. The host/manager comes over and says "management has changed, and we will no longer honor that deal."

Hmm... interesting. I have, essentially, a contract saying that it never expires, for an establishment with the exact same name and location as they have, and they are saying they don't have to honor it.

Well, the meal would have been over $100 for the 2 of us anyway, since the food is so overpriced (minimum price for a meat dish is like $30+), so we decided to just take our business elsewhere. Instead of getting the chance to (a) honor our ALREADY-PAID-FOR certificate; (b) win over a repeat customer for the future (we are relatively local); and (c) have us bring additional big-spending business associates there when they visit for company matters... instead, they got ZERO dollars from us 

(it was a blessing in disguise, because we went and spent $130 at Le Trappe, the Belgian food/beer place a few blocks down on Columbus, which was a great little discovery...)

From the fact that a nearly-empty restaurant still treats their customers like crap and won't honor existing agreements, they clearly don't care whether they get your business... so I suggest you just don't give it to them. I know I won't.
author: Matthew G.

description: I wish there was a chance to provide two ratings: one for food, one for service. The food is amazing and quite reasonably priced for San Francisco. Unfortunately this does not translate in service. The maitre'd was very charming and attentive but our server was anything but. I will say he seemed busy and I take that into consideration but wait time on drinks was lengthy and the server did not seem to notice. If possible, eat at the bar to enjoy the amazing food and skip the middle man.
author: Heather L.

description: We loved this place.  The  gnocchi was as tender as we've ever had.  Service was friendly and impeccable, food a knockout.  We went on Sunday afternoon and finished lunch as Mal Sharpe's band began.  We stayed and enjoyed the music with our coffees.  No pressure, relaxed and fun.  I plan on going again on Sunday afternoons for a small plate or two, glass of wine and music.  A real bargain, but I also want to go for a full-on fancy dinner.  I could eat here every day.  The valet parking was a reasonable price ($9 for 3 hours) and greatly appreciated in parking-nightmare SF.
author: GG M.

description: my fav restaurant in North Beach. We loved everything: prosciutto and melon, prawns and pancetta with garlic, pasta fagioli, fettuccine Alfredo's. I'll come back for osso bucco.  We just need the owner Gianni to set up a Fior D'Italia in Portland.
author: Maura D.

description: Love the atmosphere. Come here for 1/2 off bar bites before 6 and you won't be disappointed. The bartenders are so friendly and provide great service. I can't give it 5 stars because I've had food from both the restaurant and the bar, and it just seems like the bar bites pack more of a flavor punch than the actual menu food at a fraction of the cost. Overall, great place for a few drinks and a quick bite.
author: Laura C.

description:
We arrived at Fior D'Italia about 6:30 pm on Saturday, September 28. No reservations. They were just finishing up a wedding reception, and weren't open for supper until 7:00. We were told it would be about 45 minutes and that they had to clear 7 and 730 reservations. Since we could smell the garlic, olive oil and wine, we decided it might be worth the wait.

The restaurant clearly caters to locals and regulars. We sat at about 7:50, but they seemed to somehow make room for everyone who came it.

We started with the shrimp wrapped in prosciutto, which was frickn awesome. Garlic, olive oil, salty - and served HOT. Delicious. My wife had the saltimbocca, which was excellent. I suggest about 25% less sage, since that was the dominant flavor, but it was rich and flavorful. Pounded thin, cooked in butter, olive oil, with a nice sauce with broth and wine. Very tasty.
I had the Osso Bucco, which is one of my benchmark dinners at an Italian restaurant, and Fior did not disappoint. There was no gremolata, but the broth was rich enough with the right flavors that I found it did not matter. Tender and juicy, full of flavor, with just a little pink. Again, full of rich flavors. In both cases, supper was served very hot, so the food had obviously not been sitting out before it was brought to the table.

We had dessert, but for the life of me I can not remember what we had - so I would probably say that it just did not make an impression.

Overall, even though we had to wait for a table, they made room for walk ins on a busy Saturday evening, the food was excellent, and the service was fast.
author: Jon-Louis H.

description: Great atmosphere and amazing food! We are from the East Coast and were in SF looking for a little taste of Italy like we find in the Bronx on Arthur Ave (famous for the Italian food) and Fior d'Italia was it! They boast to be the oldest Italian restaurant in the country and while I was skeptical at first, the old pictures on the wall offer some evidence that this could be true. Highly recommended. Note: although seemingly fancy with the decor, we came in jeans, sneakers and a t-shirt and didn't feel under dressed.
author: Amelia N.

description:
I had an incredible experience. The entire staff as well as the guests were the most welcoming people I came into contact with during my short stay in San Francisco. The food was delicious as well as the wine. Quail with polenta, outstanding, as well as the pasta.

Phil from Boston, Grazie!
author: Phillip B.

description:
Dinner nice. Lasagne was piping hot and good.
A little cramped but okay.
Waiter did a good job. Only complaint bread nothing but air and no butter. 
Will return!
author: Chip S.

description: My husband and I came here twice during the week prior to Super bowl 50. Monday night, very quiet,  lovely service,  and the food was excellent.  Wednesday night,  they had a nice little jazz band with a singer. I enjoyed the Gnocchi so much, I got it both times. I substituted the bolognese sauce in place of  creamy tomato sauce. Perfection!  Light little pillows of goodness. My husband had the Trenette al pesto one night and the lasagna bolognese al Forno the second visit. Both were excellent. We didn't try appetizers, salads or dessert as the pasta was so filling. Great location, got there easily by cable car from Union Square, walked a block and a half and we were there. Don't miss this lovely little gem.
author: Catherine S.

description: We were disappointed with our dinner last night. The service and ambiance was great but the food was lacking. Two of us got the linguine with tomato sauce & meatballs and both of us did not enjoy it. The noodles were mushy and the meatballs were not tasty. The minestrone soup lacked salt and the Caesar salad was nothing to rave about. Another person in our party got the basil cream egg pasta, which lacked salt. The only dish ordered that we liked was our vegetarian diner who ordered homemade pasta with a spicy tomato sauce. We did not get a good meal for the money.
author: Jacquelibe B.

description: Love this place, I had the Pasta e fagioli for a starter and Lasagna for the main course! My wife had the fettuccine alfredo and poached pears for desert! All dishes were well prepared and served in a timely manner. The service was excellent! Could not have asked for a better dining experience.
author: Chad L.

description: Service was absolutely incredible! I went here for a banquet and they were extremely attentive the entire time. Also, between the appetizers, pasta dish, main entree, and tiramisu dessert, I was in heaven! They have a great wine selection as well.
author: Melissa G.

description:
I guess I wrote my original review on the wrong page? Hopefully this page is correct.

My boyfriend and I went out on a date night here a few days ago and it was just lovely! 

We had a deal from http://Howaboutwe.com that got us one appetizer, one salad, and two entrees. There was a bit of a mixup at first and our waiter (Gill, who was very sweet and helpful by the way) told us to order only from the list of items that were excluded from the offer (which was a very small list) but once we sorted that out we ordered our actual items and received some bread and drinks very promptly! Gill also made a delicious wine recommendation. Also the maitre d was very attentive and apologized about the menu mixup and stopped by a few times to see if we were enjoying everything.

In addition to the items we ordered from the deal, we also ordered fresh oysters and some cocktails. The Suffering Bastard is delicious. My boyfriend got it and I almost wanted to order one along with my wine. :P The oysters were also very delicious and fresh but out of the 6 we got, two had some grit. It was also super awkward as I was picking shell bits out of my mouth when the maitre d stopped by and asked how we were doing so I had to cover my mouth and just be like, "MMMMHMM, GREAT, THANK YOU" 

But besides that, everything was delicious. The ravioli I had was awesome. My boyfriend liked the gnocci but said it wasn't as good as his mom's (but that is biased obviously, I enjoyed it and thought it was good). Everyone there was super friendly, attentive (but not overly so) and helpful and made the experience wonderful! 

Also, at the time of day we went (5:30-6:30 or 7ish) the sun was coming through all the glass windows and it cast everything in such a lovely glow. It was beautiful. I really enjoyed the whole atmosphere and even though the neighborhood outside isn't particularly visually appealing (there was some construction and street cleaning going on) it looked lovely that day from where we were sitting. I definitely want to go again sometime!
author: Aimee P.

description: Don't forget to check the tiramisu and espresso after you finish the wonderful main dishes!
author: Luiz I.

description: Lovely evening. Rack of Lamb and Ravioli Di Zucci were delicious. OMG! Just sit there and eat the crusty bread all night long! Excellent! PS- mush better than the stinking rose!
author: Patrick M.

description:
Went to a large group dinner here recently.  This used to be the San Remo restaurant a long time ago.  We were taken to a back room which was perfect for the event.  Fixed price and choice of three entrees.  I was not a big fan of the chicken breast with tomato sauce and olives.  Salad was good.  Service was excellent, considering the size of the group.  I'll need to come back and try the restaurant instead of the banquet.  

Flor D'Italia is located very close to Fisherman's Wharf despite not being that close to the water.  Certainly worth dining here if you're staying in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Doctor G.

description: We were in the city for the weekend and looked on Yelp for decent restaurants near our hotel. I'm glad we discovered Fior d'Italia. The service was great and we had an appetizer, two entrees and a bottle of wine for under $100. It was really cool to see all the old photographs.
author: Jennifer G.

description: Truly a special place.  The food is excellent, especially the mushroom risotto.  As others have said and I can verify, the service is really exception.  Quite a neighborhood gem.
author: David J.

description: Loved the clam/calamari risotto!
author: F. E.

description: Being a New Yorker, Italian restaurants never measure up.   I found this place on Yelp and the reviews were incredible.  It was not until I visited that I learned about the history.   It felt like an old school NYC restaurant.   Service was incredible and the food was terrific.   The Burrata, tomato and basil was fantastic; pasta and chicken too.  My mom had the lasagna and loved it.   Loved the vibe and the history was the icing on the cake.   Highly recommend. :-)
author: Emma W.

description:
A very friendly restaurant with lots of history.  

We ordered a Linguine with white clam sauce and we were not satisfied with the sauce, it came too dry, not creamy enough.  The waitress took the plate away and talked to the manager.  The manager came over, apologized, explained to us the way they made the dish and had the kitchen remake the dish.

Will definitely come back again, especially with the Groupon deals.
author: Theodore H.

description: Summary of hilariously awful meal last night: ask 3 times for butter with that nice bread; no water refills; a dried up fake Caesar wilted salad that was far from a Caesar & we had to ask for a plate as we were sharing. But the best event: the Chef races out of the kitchen  to our table to inquire why I want his mushroom sauce on the side of my veal chop! You must be kidding! I didn't want his Campbell Soup mushroom sauce on that nice veal chop. 1 friend had a good veal piccata &  my veal chop was really nice despite 2 minuscule thumb sized potatoes on the plate - just leave em off & forget the soggy asparagus - hey this is California where we have great fresh veggies.  Other friend had dried up overcooked Bolognese Tagliatelle - stick the fork in & the whole bowl comes up with it! UGH -  As a former fan of the real Fior when it was at the now Original Joe's location, we 3 loved the old place and our  message to you is: do not go here!  Dining room had 10 tourists  and we sat near bar to at least enjoy all the fun DOGS that were at the bar with their families - we're pet friendly folks and loved that.
author: Guido B.

description:
After looking at reviews I thought this place would be a great place to celebrate my wife's 35th bday. However we are not pleased with this place. 
SERVICE::We sat down and it seems that we were not wanted there. My wife is Mexican and I am Indian so I hope it's not because of race. Anyhow, we wanted bread and saw that everyone has a basket. We waited for 22 mins and no bread showed up. I asked politely if we could have some from another server.  Bread came out 5 mins later. Now waiting is not the bad part. Our main server had stated that I demanded bread and he didn't want to deal with me. That got me upset because I was polite. I asked to speak to a manager so we could leave. The manager was nothing but respectful and polite and offered to pay for the apps and drinks we ordered. and he asked if he could take care of us. We were uncomfortable and I just asked if we could pay and leave.  He would not let me pay. Very nice of him.
FOOD::
Salad was overdressed and salty. The melons were not ripe. The soup was very bland. Even though we could not try the main course. What we did eat was not worth the trip.
author: Neal S.

description:
when we rolled up shorts with bikes and backpacks we thought for sure they wouldn't let us in...

nope.

they're chill! sweet! 

the ambiance is the perfect mix of cozy and classy. not too lowbrow, not too uppity. ideal. service is nice. the bread is WARM and FAT. the portions are perfect.
author: Sonya Z.

description: Go to Trattoria Contadina or North Beach Restaurant instead. We had an awful meal at Flor D'Italia. The gnocchi was soft, the sauce was bland and all meat dishes were overcooked and over sauced. Very unimpressive meal.
author: Amanda B.

description: I don't understand why there wasn't a 2hr wait to get in. With a fresh rose on every table and an attentive server, the 1st impression couldn't be beat. We started with the Caesar salad for two. I am a fan of that salad and it did not disappoint- the lettuce couldn't be more crisp, the dressing, more flavorful, the cheese, more fresh. I then had the lasagna that was pretty fantastic. My love had the chicken with prosciutto half portion with the linguini and meat sauce. OMG- the meat sauce was divine and the linguini was the epitome of Al Dente. I'm in love and will be returning upon my next visit!
author: Michelle R.

description: We had our rehearsal dinner on Friday in the Tuscany Room at Fior d'Italia. They had the room set up perfectly and were very attentive to all of the guests and our needs. The food was brought out quickly and everyone left with full bellies and smiles on their faces. Thank you for a great evening!
author: Patrick S.

description: Food was delicious. I had the homemade pesto pasta, which was clearly homemade, and it was perfectly cooked and well seasoned. The pasta sampler was also amazing -  the gnocchi in particular. Very friendly and accommodating wait staff. I would definitely recommend.
author: Sarah W.

description: The best thing I had there was the bread that I am sure comes from an outside baker. Our waiter was not terribly helpful. It took him forever to come to our table and he never checked in with us to see how everything was. This was at around 4:30 PM on a work day, he was not overwhelmed or busy in any way. I had lasagna and my friend had the Risotto alla Piemontese. The lasagna was absolutely horrible. I could not find a morsel of meat in it and the sauce was an orangish color. It was the kind of thing that you know was put together in an unthoughtful lazy way. No layering of béchamel, bolognesem and pasta was attempted.  The frozen stuff you get at the grocery store is far superior.  The Risotto was not bad, but subpar for a restaurant that advertises itself as 'fine dining'. We also ordered Funghi di Selva Trifolati. Which is basically an assortment of three wild mushrooms sautéd in garlic and parsley. You think they could not mess this up? Yes they can and they did. This was very pungent. I do not mean garlicky pungent, but very old mushroom pungent. It was really not edible. After the horid dining experience, we decided to skip the desert and jolt out of there as fast as possible. The atmosphere is old school Italian without any attempt to update or clean it up. If that is your thing, go there for drinks, but skip the food.
author: nima d.

description: I ordered the seafood pasta. The seafood and pasta were over cooked, and the sauce was bland and runny/watery. There was a bad mussel in there, which we pointed out to the waiter, and he didn't care and made me feel like I was an annoying customer. We never got our water filled and only saw our waiter when the check came. I would not recommend coming to this place.
author: H. L.

description: Very fine Italian cuisine, good food, great taste. If you like traditional Italian food this is the one.
author: Falah A.

description:
12/31/2016: Update, finally made it here for dinner and it didn't disappoint.  The Bucatini Amatriciani was amazing and my two servings of freshly grated parmesan didn't hurt! Another repeat dish will be the prosciutto wrapped prawns, crispy perfectly cooked nuggets. 


Previous post: Bar hopping on a Sunday late afternoon got a recommendation from a local pub of where to go for snacks and a great happy hour and boy where they right.  Their happy hour was half price on appetizers and drinks every day.  We tried the calamari, meatballs and the steak tips and I rate them in that order.  The fried calamari was barely breaded which meant the seafood needed to be top notch and cooked perfectly and it was, very tender and tasty.  The meatballs were moist and sitting in a hearty red sauce which paired perfectly with the sour dough bread we were given.  Not a drop of sauce was left on the plate.  The steak tips were OK but they wouldn't be something I would order again, the sauce was a bit sour for me.  But I will say we did finish them.  Can't wait to return on another one of our weekend bar strolls in North Beach.
author: Dianne M.

description:
Great service and atmosphere
This cafe was highly recommended
Expected better food. With that, can only rate it a 3. 

.
author: Andy F.

description:
Food was decent to good. Service was TERRIBLE.

We were constantly, actively ignored by our waiter and had to literally beg for bread while it seemed like the other tables were being automatically served bread upon being seated. 

The other restaurant staff seemed pleasant enough...

Racial discrimination or simply a case of a waiter having a bad day or what? You figure it out... I don't have the time to...
author: Rajesh R.

description: This is the best place to have gnocchi's! This is always our first restaurant when we come to SF! Thank you for always keeping your food & service always consistent.
author: Debbie M.

description: Just WOW!! The oldest Italian restaurant is still thriving! We were here six years ago and fell in love. Never thought we would be back in this part of the country again but weather prevented us from returning to the east coast. We knew we had to come!! Everything was top notch. Try the fresh pastas that are made daily. They never disappoint. The sauces are homemade and are amazing as well. Very attentive staff to boot.
author: Elisabeth S.

description: My favorite place!!!  I feel like I'm at home!  EVERYONE that works here is as friendly as apple pie!!!  The happy hour from 4-7 pm is awesome! Great food and drinks!  Cheap especially  for the quality of the food!!!  Great service!!!  I cannot say enough good things about his Fior!!!!  Just come by and you will alway return :)
author: Dmitry K.

description:
I recommend happy hour.  1/2 off all drinks and bar food from 4-7pm everyday. 

Unfortunately happy hour was the best part of the meal, our dinner was just ok, nothing spectacular.  I ordered the Linguini Con Vongole.  The sauce had way to much oil and not a lot of flavor.  I tried my girlfriends Chicken Marsala which they made special for her so extra star for the service.  The sauce was good but the chicken was overcooked and chewy.  

The menus seem like something the Olive Garden would hand you.  They are one piece of paper front and back with some colorful design on them.  Very cheesy.  It is just weird for a restaurant that has been around as long as this place.  I expect a nice menu in a nice leather case or similar.  

I'm sad to say, we will not be going back anytime soon.  Its unfortunate because this place used to be so good.
author: Mike G.

description: Loved our dining experience here! I am Italian and I've made pasta with my family many times growing up. The homemade pasta is spot on! It's off the beaten path which is perfect for the non-touristy feel. My wife started with the minestrone and I had the fried calamari. Both excellent! Bread was scrumptious!  The calamari was perfect and the soup full of flavor and substance (not a ton of liquid).  We kept it simple with the lasagna and gnocchi. Both light, simple, yet full of flavor. I prefer beer over wine and they do have an IPA on tap which is what I had.  Highly recommend! Good start to the new year! We'll be back :)
author: Josiah B.

description:
Had not been to Fior D'Italia in many many years and was not disappointed that we made the journey into the city. The restaurant had moved some years ago and this was my first time at the new location. Very nice! The bar and dinning room have a great feel to them and the service is just what I expect when I go to dinner in San Francisco. 
We started of with drinks and calamari, then moved into the good stuff, dinner. I had the rack of lamb and my wife had the veal picatta. Both spot on. Wine list was good, but not great. A few more Sonoma County wines on the list would have been a plus.

All in all, a very good evening. The only reason I did not give it five stars was the three dogs that where inside the bar when we walked in. They where still there when we left. Dogs in a restaurant? I am a dog lover, but I do know when to leave him home.

I will be back, definitely.
author: Steve S.

description: Caesar salad and bread alone are all you need.  Had the salmon with dill sauce and it was cooked perfect. Great place
author: mike d.

description:
Our last night on a business trip to San Francisco, we decided to try this restaurant that we pass often. Throwback styling with white tablecloths and moniker stemware created a neat ambiance. Wood carving of a gent in a chef's coat was cool.

Service was good. Bread delivered quickly. Olive oil tasted freshly pressed. We ordered fresh oysters and pancetta wrapped prawns. Delicious. Careful of the Tabasco sauce on the oysters. Very strong 

Entrees of fresh pasta lived up to the hype of the menu. Pesto was good.

Worth a visit if you want to try something in North Beach that is not Fisherman's Wharf kitschy.
author: Scott G.

description: The food is excellent. The service was exceptional. My only issue is that I just found out about this great restaurant today! Go now for a reasonably priced, delicious meal!
author: Michael B.

description: Lovely place. The staff are friendly and gracious. Very tasty dinner. I loved the minestrone and gnocchi. The kids loved the pasta and Shirley Temple drinks.
author: Dusty G.

description: Nailed a classic that is often looked over with the fettuccine. The pasta itself felt house made. Just sat at the bar and was happy to stumble into. Bartenders were accommodating and attentive to all at the bar. Crowd was definitely an older crowd as I believe this place is viewed as a classic. Id still bring a date ;)
author: Martin D.

description:
Atmosphere: very nice & friendly. There was a jazz playing the night I was there & the music was nice 
Food: I had the calamari as an appetizer and the pesto pasta for the main dish, both were salty, flavorless and below average overall
Service: just ok
author: Ifred M.

description:
This is a traditional S.F. Italian restaurant. I come here for the real feel and taste of North Beach. This is a new location for them. They had a severe fire at the old place. I had my favorite hamburger sandwich for lunch; about a pound of delicious burger between two big pieces of sourdough bread, cut in half. Add your own fixings. If it was dinner time, I would have had the veal piccata. Love it. Drop by and give them a new send off.
Oh, I forgot. They are now located where the Old San Remo restaurant used to be.  San Remo was one of my all time favorites as a kid. My parents brought me here all the time. Great place, great location, lot's of memories. The new location for Fior D'Italia works as both are real North Beach Icons. Trust me, you'll love the place, the food and the service.
author: George C.

description: Unbelievably impressive - both with their food and their service.  This is a MUST go to restaurant when in San Francisco.  Oldest one still in existence.  You will not be disappointed!!!  Fresh homemade pasta, entrees and desserts.  Can't wait to return.
author: Patty S.

description: Excellent Italian food near fisherman's wharf. We had pancetta-wrapped prawns, pumpkin ravioli, scallopini, and salmon with butter and capers. There was a good portion of vegetables with each entree. The bread was fantastic and so was our panna cotta dessert.
author: Greg M.

description:
We were a party of six that were in town for the day and looking forward to a nice italian dinner.  We were driving around North Beach on a Saturday night looking for parking - dumb!  We were just about ready to give up when we drove by Fior D'Italia and noticed they had valet parking for $9/per car.  We were hungry and tired of driving around so it worked for us.  We checked out the menu and it looked great - and they were able to accommodate the six of us with no reservation around 8pm.

Several of us had the house salad (a little bland, $7) and I had the minestrone soup (very tasty and not too watery, $7).  The french bread served was warm and delicious.  Following are the entrees we ordered:

Lasagna (good, a little bland $14)
Bucatini Amatriciana (requested linguini instead of spaghetti and the dish was very tasty! $14)
Tenette al Pesto (very tasty, $14)
Veal Chop (huge, very tasty, $36)

Cocktails ordered were gin martinis (made perfectly) and house red wine.  No desserts ordered as we were tired and didn't want to extend the evening longer.  It did take quite a long time to receive our entrees after the apps and they didn't have a full house, but, oh well.

Overall, our dinner was nice.  The prices were very reasonable and the ambiance was great.  We'll try other restaurants in the area before we come back, only because there are so many other options.  But we will be back some day
author: Buba M.

description: What a gem to find amongst all the alternatives. Such a wonderful atmosphere with great food. We travelled with 3 couples and traded off selecting where to eat. We had already dined at 4 fantastic restraunts and the pressure was on me to select something to top them all. Well this place did not disappoint!!!  And I found it on YELP so thanks to you all for your reviews.
author: Randy L.

description: Truly the best Lasagna I've ever had and a really great atmosphere. This is the oldest Italian restaurant in America. Cool to be here and read the history of the 3 fires. Really great service and food. Also really great rating and quality olive oil. This place is great!
author: Andrew M.

description: Our food was fantastic, prices were very reasonable for San Fran and they accommodated our group of 15 people within 10 minutes.  I had the Minestrone soup and the Veal Picatta and both were very good.  I look forward to going back again.
author: Jason W.

description: Tasty and warm bread. Love. Pesto pasta was a little too creamy for my taste. I prefer a more oil based sauce. My husband's prawns in white wine and garlic were delicious. I plopped a couple of those bad boys on top of my dish, and I was pretty happy. Good wine choices. Very warm interiors and helpful and attentive servers.
author: Robin A.

description: Divine fresh food and service is fantastic. If u want a real Italian experience come here. Like old world Italy
author: Bennett D.

description: Great food, excellent service, luxurious atmosphere.  Reasonable corkage fee (18 per bottle).   My friends and I went here for post valentines day triple date.  All of us loved our food, we actually couldn't help sharing.  Not a single dish was disappointing, and I think we ordered 14 all together.  Our waitress was an opera singer and we asked her to sing for our table, it was the highlight of the evening.  Also, get the desserts with wine, it is delicious.  Lovely experience.
author: Rachel O.

description: My boyfriend and I were excited to try "the oldest Italian restaurant in America" while staying in San Francisco. This trip is a special occasion for us and we are not looking to spend much money but wanted to have one nice dinner and we chose this place, but we were very disappointed.  Our server seemed pushy and not too excited. He proceeded to ignore us for most of the night and water didn't even make it to the table before the appetizer did. My boyfriend asked for mushrooms with his fettuccine and he told us it would be an extra charge, but usually it is $1-$5, so we said that was fine. The food was OK but definitely not worth the price. When we got the bill, the mushrooms alone were $12. They called it "mushroom sauté" even though it was literally just mushrooms added to the noodle dish. As soon as I paid the bill was snatched from our table. And we were ignored by the man distributing bread. Over all we were deeply disappointed and would not recommend this place to people.
author: Brenna P.

description: Yesterday, 5/10, we came to Fior D' Italia for an early dinner.  Our party included 5 adults and two children, one of which was 5 1/2 months old.  Even though we were not dressed as well as some of the other patrons we were treated with the same respect.  Though the food was excellent it was the service that made us instant fans.  We came in with a stroller that didn't seem to bother the staff-when it started to become a bit busier they placed it in another location and brought it to us as we were leaving.  Through out our entire meal we were well taken care of.  I must say thank you for a great experience.
author: Leonard A.

description: This is a great spot with an excellent bar! Staff was friendly and very accommodating.
author: Noah F.

description: Great experience.  good hardworking crew working there and new owner. Try the veal parmigiana, still my favorite.
author: sam c.

description:
Recently ate here.   The price of the dinner can add up since everything is separate.  When you add in the salad, entree, and a just a glass of wine hits the tail end of the spendy range.

The Good:
The salads that we had were excellent.

The just OK:
I had the raviolis in bolognese sauce.  It was good, just not great.
My wife had the fettuccine alfredo which uses an egg noodle.  It was not that good to us.

The Bad:
Service.  Very slow service and the waiter did not do the standard how are you doing and is there something else I can get you.  

Don't think that we will be going back on our next visit to SF.
author: James W.

description: Came here for dinner on Easter. This might be my new favorite Italian restaurant in North Beach. All our entrees were flawless, and they got all the little things right too (e.g. great tasting olive oil). The staff was extremely fast and friendly. For example, the manager stopped by to ask us about our meal and saw we were sharing entrees - he immediately ran to the kitchen and got us extra plates to make things easier (without asking).
author: Amit V.
