description: The owner apologized for the message that was apparently meant for someone else. Again, the food was very good and we had good service.
author: Sheila M.

description:
Had a group dinner of 30 in private room for business.

All the staff did a great job. Bartender even helped my guests beforehand by giving them excellent service with happy hour prices. Octavio our server and Lalo the manager made sure we all had a good time. Food was very good, atmosphere fun.

Enjoy. Highly recommend if near wharf, but don't want extreme touristy feel.
author: Bob F.

description: I came here about a month ago with my mom for dinner.  We arrived and it was mostly empty but a nice looking place overall.  We ordered drinks, an appetizer and dinner and everything was really good.  After dinner we got the bill and informed our server that we had a half-off coupon from Half Off TV. We were told that they could no longer accept those because ownership of the restaurant had changed and the new owner was not accepting them.  WOW! what a load of cr*p! There is no expiration  date on the voucher nor does it specify that it would be void if ownership changes.  On top of it all we spoke with the general manager who offered to give us 15% off our bill.  Gee thanks, but no thanks. Unfortunately we will NEVER go here again.  They should have honored our coupon considering how much money we spent and we also would have returned many times.
author: Danika F.

description: Went here for Christmas Dinner and very disappointed. They ran out of bread, chicken, veal and salad. Service was very lacking. We talked to the manager after and expressed our disappointment and he was very apologetic and reduced the bill charges. We've never eaten out on Christmas Day and would think twice about doing so again.
author: Brad C.

description: We were staying at the San remo right next door, so thought we would have to give "Americas oldest italian restaurant" a try. We had high expectations due to this claim. The happy hour specials are totally worth it - really good apps and drinks, and for cheap - but the dinner fell short. My fiancé liked his tortellini, but my veal was really dry, and came with no pasta and one tiny little baby potato (should have come with like 6). They also only gave us like 3 tiny slices of thin bread. Needless to say, we were still hungry. The service was pretty good though.
author: Martha S.

description: I celebrated my 70th birthday in one of their banquet rooms. Everyone had a wonderful time enjoying the food and service.  Lucio was a great, helping me through all the planning and Romero was a wonderful server the night of my party.  Thanks!
author: Cynthia M.

description:
My family and I decided to try something new for lunch. Usually, we go to Scoma's, but my mom heard of this place and wanted to try it. 
This place is really good. I had their ravioli de zucca, which was delicious. Some restaurants that make this same dish go a bit heavy on the butter, but this place made it very light. I didn't get that oily feeling. My brother had the linguine with clams and loved his dish. My mom had their house salad. My dad had their linguine with meatballs. My parents enjoyed their food.
The portion size is just right compared to Scoma's, which are huge and their dishes are in the 25-34 dollar range. If you're looking for good italian food at an affordable price come here.
author: Sarah S.

description: The service and the food was absolutely amazing!  We would love to live next door to this quaint little Italian place just to drop in every Sunday afternoon. You won't be disappointed.
author: John R.

description: One of the best happy hours in the city! Especially enjoy the calamari and flatbread.
author: Peter F.

description: Its a beautiful restaurant but i was disappointed by the ny steak. Sauce was really heavy. They ran.out of.lamb. Service is good and they have valet. Panna cotta was really stiff.
author: Tiff W.

description: Happy hour. One of the best in town. So surprised this place is not commonly listed as one of the best happy hour spots in town.  They offer half off apps and drinks 4-7pm M-F. You can't beat that. The food is good, not great. The drinks are amazing. They have great bartenders. Hidden happy hour gem that I hope doesn't get too crowded.
author: Sannie C.

description:
Me and my wife and son ate at Fior D'Itaiia for New Years Eve. It is located in the North Beach district off of Bay St. It is a short distance from Fisherman's Wharf also.
The reservations were for 6:00 so we arrived on time and entered through the bar door and escorted over to the restaurant's entrance where we met with the host who is a amiable and friendly guy. The ambiance of this restaurant is pleasant and the noise level here was reasonable. It was not crowded at all at this time of the early evening. We were seated and the waiter quickly arrived and took our orders. I had the veal picata which came with potato and sting beans, the wife had the chicken with the same sides and my son had the fish. We also ordered a side of sauteed mushrooms which were good/ Dinner also comes with bread and there is olive oil for dipping. The food was presented well and tasty. For dessert we shared tiramisu and my son opted for vanilla ice cream. I also ordered a capuchino to go along with the dessert The tiramisu is served in a sundae glass and doesn't look like the traditional cake I am used to but more like a ice cream dessert. It was okay, not what I expected though.The price for dinner including a mixed drink and a glass of house chardonnay was very reasonably priced.
The waiter was efficient and the other waiter staff were all good.
There is valet parking for $9.00 which is very nice.
Overall we had an enjoyable experience here
author: jack d.

description: Not great!  Friendly environment, nice wait staff and cosy environment.  The staff and host were very friendly!  The food not so friendly!  If you don't care to be impressed with your meal and don't care about money this is the place!  If you care about how your food tastes and aren't a millionaire, steer clear of this place!  Why can't all Italian food experiences taste like Incanto on Church street?!!!
author: P M.

description: Everything was great. We sat in the bar for 45 min before our ressie and had 2 great appetizers (ravioli with veal ragu and tomato bruschetta). Then when we sat down, we had cioppino and filet with a red wine reduction sauce and tiramisu. Everything we ate was fabulous, the service was impeccable (Octavio was one in a million!) and we have zero complaints, only raves. Highly highly recommend!
author: Jen B.

description: We were looking for nice italian dinner in the wharf area and the bellman at our hotel suggested this.  WOW.  What a treat.  The food and service were both top notch, the restaurant was beautiful, and it had a vibe right out of goodfellas.  I would visit the wharf area again just to eat there.    Everything we had during our meal was delicious, fresh and hot.  And the beer was very cold.  And try the homemade spumoni ice cream, I don't even like spumoni and it was out of this world!
author: Judy G.

description:
Came here on a busy Saturday night in a party of 8.  Our server was fantastic...  There was a dining room with a party of 75 and he recommended that we get our order in before them to avoid delays.  This wasn't a rush tactic - with 2 children in our party the last thing you want is a delay in the food.  All aspects of service were good.

In terms of appetizers, we had the fried calamari.  It was done perfectly with just a light batter and good seasoning.

Someone in our party ordered a veal dish and our server actually came back afterwards and apologized for the small serving, took it away, and came back with a new dish that had an additional medallion.  Granted, the servings was still on the small side but it was a nice gesture.

I had the seafood pasta special.  Lots of seafood (clams, mussels, shrimp, bay scallops), pasta done just right, and the cream sauce was perfect.  I also had the opportunity to try the black risotto and it was cooked perfectly..

It was a little pricey but I'd come back again to explore more of the menu.
author: Michael L.

description: We went here because we had a gift certificate, and it was very close to our hotel. We ordered the cheese plate, ceasar salad, and potato gnocchi to share. The prices were reasonable, but the food wasn't very impressive. The cheese plate had a lot of cheese, but not much variety. The salad had a bit too much dressing and no crutons! :( I'll admit the gnocchi was very good, but not enough to make me ever want to return. Also our waiter was a bit weird and the decor seems outdated.
author: Stacy S.

description:
The single worst piece of fish I've ever been served in my long history of dining. Pathetic. I'm not one to complain excessively about food .. even my negative reviews here are tempered and balanced. But that this piece of petrale even made it out of the kitchen is proof that this restaurant, under new ownership or not, is already in grave danger. Awful ..  not fresh or properly cooked, splashed carelessly with some oil and adorned with the sorriest small portion of unappetizing green beans ever assembled. Honestly, the plate was a joke .. its appearance alone seemed a pointed attempt to discourage the recipient to ever come back here. Whoever was in the kitchen and allowed this to pass as edible, presentable, or just plain unoffensive, should be told to switch professions. Fior D'Italia may be the oldest restaurant in San Francisco .. but that tenure is about to end if they keep this up. 

The service was fine .. a real shame that a competent waiter would be forced to bring a meal like this to the table.

1/5/13 - Following up a few days later. With perspective and having had time to process the experience reasonably .. I stick by my assessment that this was the worst, most poorly presented, unappetizing piece of fish I've ever been served in a restaurant. Read my other reviews .. I never express such extreme distaste. Simply awful.
author: R M.

description: While the place has a nice setting, we had a terrible experience. During lunch we asked if we can order Gluten free and we were told of two options. Little did we know that the dish comes at a 215% price adder. In addition, it was extremely small, and the grilled chicken was super dry and burned. I complained and got a lot of shoulder shrugging and being told that this is just what they charge since they don't like to alter the dishes they offer ... I ended up with a 15% discount (on a 215% price adder) ...
author: stefan g.

description: One of the best Italian meals I have ever had and I have been to Italy 5 times. The food was great and the service was the friendliest I have ever had.  If I lived in San Fran I would be a regular. The waiters wear ties and suits and the atmosphere is wonderful. By the way, I order calamari at every restraint that serves it, this was the best calamari I have ever had, period.
author: Steve W.

description:
I went to this restaurant on 2 Jan 2013 (wednesday night) with 11 people (my wife's and I families). This was my first time along with my family, however my wife's family has been here plenty of times before with good reviews. I called a week prior to make reservations with the manager and he insisted that we would be able to be seated in a "somewhat" excluded room that usually fits a party of 12. Once arriving to the restaurant the tables were set up in the middle of the restaurant and no one knew about the reservation for the side room. The employees stated that it would've been too small for our party of 11. I was thought to myself well why was it offered? To include non of us are on the hefty side. To make things easier I agreed and sat where the tables have been set up. 

The next issue we had was that we ordered 3 different appetizers (1 of each) and they must've assumed that we wanted 3 of each. They kept saying "we will take care of you."  The appetizers were WAY more than enough and went to waste where they just pulled it away and never asked if we wanted to save it. Afterwards I asked if the appetizers served were 1 or 3 servings of each, where they answered 3 and caused us to be dumbfounded since no one ordered 3 of each.  However I feel no one complained due to the fact that two different families were still trying to get to know each other. On a good note the Calamari in Cesta and Salmone in Carpione were excellent dishes, however the Gamberoni allo Spiedo in Pancetta was very salty where we had shrimp left over. 

The last issue here was a miscommunication. We asked the newly young if we were able to have a couple wine glasses. He states "we can take care of you" so he wraps 4 glasses, and quickly puts them in a bag and I said "thanks!" He seemed busy so he went straight to the register while I gave him a "bye" wave and said thanks again while walking off (he said nothing nor tried to stop me). Half the party slowly exiting he hands a receipt to one of my in laws saying "heres the receipt" and in law replies "thanks" and starts walking off. The manger replies "someone needs to pay for the glasses." Once again confused, the in law hands me the receipt and I pay for that after spending $600 for dinner which I thought was complimentary. 

I do have to admit my chicken breast was cooked very well, however the in laws said the food was mediocre compared to before the new ownership and the menu is half of what it was before. Just my 2 cents.
author: Jonny B.

description: We happened to stumble upon this restaurant while walking through SF and decided to make a reservation. We are glad we did! The food was absolutely delicious. I had the seafood linguine and my fiancé had the pesto pasta. My fiancé even tried my seafood linguine and enjoyed it, even though he's not the biggest fan of seafood! We tried several drinks from sparkling wines to martinis and a port with dessert. Dessert was just as good; we tried the chocolate gelato and the caramel creme. The service was awesome - very attentive and made several suggestions when we couldn't decide. We definitely will come back and hope to try new things on the menu!
author: Joy B.

description: This place is Great!  The Service was amazing, probably one of the best experiences I have had in the restaurant industry.  The food is delicious, with a lot of flavor!  I would def. recommend coming here for all occasions.  The people that left the bad reviews are completely crazy, and I would DEF. recommend coming here!
author: David F.

description:
Great atmosphere, great service, and great food.  We were a party of six for lunch and everyone had something different.  No complaints from anyone.  For starters we shared oysters on the half shell and fried calamari.  The oysters were fresh and the calamari were light and crispy, not heavy and greasy as is often the case with fried calamari.  I had the Tagliatelle alla Bolognese for an entree and it was perfect.  The pasta was cooked just right and the sauce was a flavorful balance of beef, tomato, and spices - not too heavy on any ingredient.  

Years ago I had frequented the restaurant in it's former location on Washington Square and the chef (and now owner), Gianni, has maintained the same high quality of cuisine, atmosphere, and service in it's new location.  Gianni came by for a friendly chat and our waiter, Alessandro, came up with excellent recommendations from the menu and later a brief history of Italy in general and Venice in particular (where he hails from).  All in all a very pleasant lunch in a historic restaurant.  We'll definitely be back.
author: Gregg M.

description: Came back this evening and WOW!  What a great experience.  Had the chicken pesto with sun dried tomatoes and it was amazing. Others at my table had the veal, salmon and steak and everyone's meal was fantastic.  I don't know why others have given bad reviews. Perhaps the place was just reopening and had some stumbles but go back and give it a second chance.   Had the chocolate mouse for dessert and it was perfect.   This is now my favorite North Beach restaurant, the staff are extremely helpful and welcoming. They remembered me from the last time I came and even remembered what I had ordered. This is definitely a family establishment and I now feel like part of the family.  Great food, services, and ambiance. What more can I saw
author: P S.

description: Ordered the risotto milanese - it was still uncooked and wholly tasteless. overpriced is an understatement. unfortunate, since its a cool neighborhood, but yet another reason to avoid north beach eateries.
author: Ash S.

description: I was so excited this place finally opened back up! They have an amazing happy hour, 50% the bar menu and drinks (I can't remember if its the specialty drinks or well drinks?). We have only been for happy hour and have never been disappointed! The mixed greens salad on the bar menu is very hearty with salumi and cheese more than greens! The Capri cocktail was fantastic, although I was a little sad they buy their lemoncello instead of making it. The meatballs are a must try on the bar menu, the sauce is amazing. The bartender is always friendly & chatty!
author: Amber M.

description: On a bus trip to San Francisco.  Our tour guide suggested this wonderful place.  Bar food half price during Happy Hour which is 4:00 - 7:00.  Shared 8 items that were excellent.  Very friendly.  Excellent service.
author: Ruth V.

description: Came here for an early dinner on a Sat evening. The service was pretty good. The food would've been a lot more enjoyable if the dishes weren't all too salty. I had the quail stuffed with sausage for my entree, the bland polenta balanced the saltiness out a bit but I still would've preferred if they saved some of the salt in the bird for the polenta. Had panna cotta for dessert. I've never had panna cotta before so I'm not sure how it's supposed to be. I liked it ok, a bit too rich/creamy for me.
author: Jenny C.

description: Like Cafe Pistola, not sure why this place isn't rated higher.  It's another classic North Beach Italian dining experience.  The meat entrees are pricey, but the pastas are delicious and reasonable.
author: Gregory N.

description: The oldest Italian in America we are told circa 1886.  Good food and service.  I had the catch of the day which was DELICIOUS.  This is the first time I've ever been to an Italian restaurant when I didn't order pasta.  It's a wonderful white table cloth quaint place.
author: Leza M.

description: Our hotel recommended this restaurant, among others, so we walked there hoping for a great Italian dinner. No one was in the dining room so we went into the bar when we saw a few people having happy hour.  The wine was half off with good choices.  From the happy hour menu we ordered the tortellini and "shrimp and avocado" salad, both of which were very tasty, but the fried calamari we had was rubbery.  We had better Italian in SF and will try other Italian restaurants recommended to us before we'll return here.
author: Gloria B.

description: Best place to belly up for a great experience at the bar, and enjoy the soft, tasty home made pasta and a few glasses of wine.  Geo and his brother Michael are the nicest bartenders.  I have been here over 10 times and only eat at this beautiful long bar.  When they closed last year, we were so sad, and now they have re opened and still have the great pasta on their menu.  I guess the old chef is the owner now, and he has added some good treats to bar menu.  They now have a great happy hour where it is half off wines by the glass and half off appetizers every day!  Score! I will definitley be back for that!
author: Cameron A.

description: Happy hour here is amazing! Half price bar food and all drinks. Doesn't get much better. Plus jazz on Wednesdays. We come here a lot and always have a great time!
author: Rachel M.

description: If you love gnocchi then you have to try this place. I guarantee you will be amazed how good it is. They melt in your mouth.  No other restaurant prepares them as good as they do trust me I tried many..... I've been coming here since I was a kid.  The restaurant had been open for over a hundred years. Food is always consistent and staff makes you feel so welcome..... I drive over 400 miles just to eat their gnocchi's I'm not kidding!
author: Admired Drunk V.

description: First off, I have to say that this review is simply my experience communicating with Lucio over the phone and not from dining or visiting the restaurant (although I would like to do both!).  My sister-in-law and brother-in-law were dining at this restaurant and celebrating a birthday and I called to leave my credit card and pay for a drink for them.  Lucio was beyond gracious and more than willing to help me do this.  He said that if they didn't order wine, perhaps I could pay for dessert if I wanted to do that?  I told him that this would be fine and he gave me the approximate price that would be charged.  He then called back 5 minutes later and said that my family had ordered a bottle of sparkling wine and asked if I would like to pay for that?  He told me exactly how much it would be.  I told him yes, that this would be wonderful.  He really went above and beyond and I was so impressed.  Grazie Lucio!  My husband and I cannot wait to visit San Francisco and dine at your restaurant!
author: Corrie P.

description: had company visiting and decided to go here since it was a block from where i am staying in north beach.  had the most beautiful evening.  live jazz, champagne and amazing food.  the lasagna was delicious as well as the silky panna cotta.  my dinner mates all had a great time also - especially the one who ordered the rabbit. such a romantic and comfortable atmosphere and the staff treats you like you are a v.i.p.
author: A M.

description: Beginning to end was just what we needed: wonderful service, menu with multiple offerings, music by Big Money in Jazz, great food (calamari, linguine and clams, and bocatini with pancetta) and wine. Ambience galore. We would return every week if we weren't from NY where Italian food is plentiful and as yummy. We know our Italian food and heritage. Next trip out in 2016 will bring us to your door with more family in tow. Grazie!
author: Liz S.

description: This place is exactly what it bills itself as - a great old school Italian joint. It's the type of place you walk into and they know your name and drink order. The bartenders and servers are all extremely friendly and love to make suggestions. Lots of good Italian food in the area, but Fior's stands out for the quality of their food and the ambiance. Get the Bucatini Amatriciana - perfect amount of spice for a pasta dish.
author: Tara T.

description: Met 6 of my friends there for a long overdue get together. We ordered calamari, antipasti, lasagna, Osso buco, spaghetti, and a dish they are well known for - pumpkin ravioli. Everything was delicious! Service was very attentive. Great place to hold a conversation with a big group. One of my friends took their banquet menu and wants to bring his plumbers union there for one of their monthly dinners.
author: Valerie C.

description: While the scotch and wine were generously poured though overpriced, the food fell well under parr. Caesar salad was overdressed on limp lettuce that tasted like it had been left out for a bit before served. The tiramisu was 80% cream and very little cake almost as if they were trying to cheap out on solid ingredients. The worst though was the New York steak. Waiter asked how I would like it cooked, I asked for medium rare. I got a dry, overcooked steak that honestly tasted like a top sirloin from a grocery store, cooked by a college student. I was extremely disappointed with what i had hoped to be a moderately priced and tasty meal in the city but what I got did not deliver at all. I do not recommend.
author: Matt F.

description: The food was great.  My husband had the seafood pasta and didn't leave anything on his plate. I enjoyed the bucatini which I myself couldn't believe how good it was. It was our first night in San Francisco and we didn't want to pick a place that was to touristy and this was just right.
author: Celi R.

description:
Restaurant is charming and really nice inside - feels like a typical old Italian restaurant with lots of character. The wine list is nothing to write home about - actually pretty lazy, lots of Safeway bottles - but you could find something for everyone. My wife had the pumpkin ravioli, which she said was fine, but lacking salt and seasoning. I ordered the quail stuffed with sage and sausage. Big portions of the sausage looked underdone, if not raw, and the texture only confirmed my suspicion. It was bright pink, unlike the rest of the (cooked) sausage. I left it on the side of my plate - it was too sage-y, and I didn't really want more, so I wasn't going to complain. The waiter, when clearing our plates, asked if everything was OK, and I said that actually the sausage was underdone. He took the plate, and returned a moment later saying the Chef had checked it out, and everything was as it should be - the sausage was supposed to be that color, and it was only the dim lighting in the dining room that made it appear otherwise. 

I actually found this pretty insulting. First of all, the customer is always right. Second, that sausage was seriously underdone. There was no question; it looked raw, and the texture of it was underdone. Third, it was still broad daylight outside, and the dining room was not *that* dimly lit. Fourth, sausage is not "two-tone" in color. If the Chef can't tell the difference, he's an idiot and should be fired. If he refuses to admit his mistake, that's just a food poisoning lawsuit waiting to happen. I didn't even want anything in return - no comp on the bill, no free dessert - I just wanted him to admit it was raw. If the winelist was amazing, or the other stuff on the menu was great, I'd consider returning and ordering differently, but since nobody in our party was thrilled with what they got, I see no reason to go back.
author: Geoff H.

description: This is the best Italian restaurant I've been to. They accommodated us even though we did not have a reservation. The food was very authentically Italian, and the service was better than excellent.  The owner, Lucio made an effort to speak to each table individually, and to make all of his guests feel at home. I now understand how the oldest Italian restaurant in the United States is still thriving.
author: Sandra M.

description: Very glad to see them re opened. Food as delicious as it ever was- most of the staff is back as well. A real San Francisco Treat. The lasagna is too good for words!
author: Tim M.

description: The service was excellent!!  It is an absolute family friendly place with a wonderful Italian atmosphere.  The food was delicious!!!!!!!!  We love your place!!
author: Krista L.

description: We came to Fior D'Italia on the recommendation of a friend from the Bay Area. The food was delicious Northern Italian cuisine. The staff was excellent and always there when you need/want them. Thank you for continuing a great Italian tradition!
author: Steve M.

description: The service was exceptional and food was good.  I guess this place is suppose to be one of the first italian restaurants and it is interesting to read all the articles and look at the old photo's.  It was easy to make a reservation and they were very accommodating even though we were dressed down compared to most of the crowd.  I ate the seafood risotto which had so many clams, pieces of calamari, and scallops that it was hard to find the rice, I couldn't finish it there was so much food.  In retrospect I would have ordered the fresh made cheese ravioli which someone ordered next to us which was a more reasonable portion.  Wine list was pretty good, including by the glass and bottle options.  They let us order a bottle and take it with us, which it was unsure if that was allowed or not.  Overall, I would return if back in San Francisco and suggest others to go if you are looking for a very good italian restaurant with great value.
author: Robyn T.

description: We had a wonderful dinner on Christmas Eve. Welcoming staff, nice & knowledgeable service in this very comfortable setting. I'd go back.
author: Ken G.

description: Friendly waiters and well maintained decor, but food tasted just average.  Portions for appetizers and main dishes are attractively arranged but lacking in size for the price ($17.00 for meatballs and spaghetti).  Will not go back.
author: Lisa M.

description: A great and fun go to place!  The food was excellent and service great.  We had the antipasto, salad, piccata, wine, just a great night.  The owner, Lucio, makes you feel like you are Family.  We will definitely go back! Bravo!!
author: John B.

description: So I would normally give this place a super solid 5 review BUT last night's experience changed that. The food is normally soooooo amazingly good, too. There were six of us in our party. We were seated in a booth with two additional chairs which was somewhat uncomfortable but we were fine with that. Our waiter seemed very busy and finally after almost 20 minutes came over to take our drink order. We ordered martinis and wine. He brought back the martinis but the martinis were the wrong ones he totally forgot the wine for almost another 10 minutes. By now we are at the 25 minute mark the restaurant was very busy. Finally the wine came and he placed our food orders most of us had pasta I had the halibut. Everyone's food came except my halibut and he apologized saying it would be out shortly so another five minutes passes while my friends are going ahead and eating I'm sitting with just my glass of wine. Then the maître d' came out and also apologize saying the food was on the way he apologized and said there was nothing more he could do please except my apologies which was very nice. Then my halibut came and I was relieved because we had a dinner theater show afterward so now I could start eating my friends were already at least halfway through their meal. The first bite of the halibut was okay but I noticed it was a little tough. The second bite I couldn't even pull the halibut away from the rest of the piece because it was 100% completely raw inside. I had to send the raw fish back it looked like it had been poached in hot boiling water for no more than maybe two minutes it definitely had not even been inside of a sauté pan. When I asked another waiter if he could help us and explain my fish was raw he immediately looked at us and yelled at our table "Who's your waiter?" And walked away. I understand when restaurants get busy and things go wrong in the bar or the kitchen it happens we understand but the rudeness of the waitstaff and the fact the food wasn't even properly prepared was not cool. it finally came back out another 10 minutes later. By now my friends had completely finished their meal and I am just starting mine. we're now late for a dinner theater by almost half an hour so the entire experience from my side was somewhat ruined and I know my friends felt bad as well. Mostly because I recommended the restaurant. I'm not sure I would go back after being treated this way. San Francisco has so many restaurants with grateful wait staff and properly cooked food. I will say the Pasta Fagioli soup is to die for, comes in a very large portion crock, large enough for a meal actually. Next time I'll just have that, IF there is a next time. What a shame.....
author: SFCAFOX S.

description: Excellent food, wonderful service and atmosphere. The restaurant was very busy the night we went, yet the staff recognized this and made sure we were attended to. I had the lasagna, the food tasted authentic and was delicious. The owner was walking around, making sure to meet all of his customers. The entire staff was very friendly and treated you like family. Excellent, I cannot wait to come back!
author: Kristen M.

description: The food here was really good and not horribly expensive. But our waiter took a ridiculously long time to do everything. It took us over an hour and a half for a simple meal. I watched other waiters working quickly and checking their tables frequently, whereas I watched our waiter walk around and talk to his coworkers instead of checking on us. I didn't even get my leftovers boxed because I knew it was going to take him forever to do it. We were done eating for a good 30 minutes by the time we got our check. It was to the point where even the host noticed we were just sitting there waiting on him and went to go get him. To me that's just very bad service so we of course tipped him very low. I probably wouldn't come back here.
author: Julie M.

description:
Went to the new Fior D'Italia. Our  luncheon was delicious. We all had the fish of the day, Petrale. It was absolutely fresh and  cooked perfectly for all. The al dente fresh string beans were delicious and the lemon completed the dish. We had a side dish of pumpkin ravioli which were good, but I think it is my personal taste that I like the traditional ravioli better. All in all, it was a great place for lunch. 
The salad was quite large but the made on the spot. Lovely. I would certainly go again.
author: Clara M.

description: Ate at Fior d'Italia last night basing it on the recommendation of the guy at the front desk of our hotel. It was a 10 minute walk through the North Beach neighborhood to get to the restaurant, which is located in an old, but charming hotel.  Locals and tourists were dining and the place was lively.  After being seated for 10 minutes with no acknowledgement,  our waiter approaches our table and asks if we are ready to order.  We tell him that we would first like to have water and order a drink. He steers me towards the "house" Pinot Noir. I order it and thought it was a very nice wine. We were each going to order a Caesar salad and split a pasta. Our waiter highly recommended the house salad. It was a generous size and very fresh. Pasta was served piping hot and cooked perfect. In true Italian fashion, there was no hurry to turn the table and we even had to ask for the check. We were rather surprised to find that our waiter's recommendations were rather pricey when the check arrived. The house salads were $16 each. Twice as much as the ceasars we were going to order. The house wine, which is typically less expensive was $17. Way to increase the amount of your tip, waiter guy!  Lesson learned: inquire as to the price when suggested by waitstaff. I do think this is an isolated incident and we just happened to get the snarky waiter.
author: Maureen W.

description: Fior D'Italia, SF, Ca..3rd location in the past 4 years, now closer to Fisherman's Wharf than North Beach. With the lack of even fair Italian cuisine in Honolulu, we ordered the staples - Prosciutto and melon was B+, Caesar's salad B, lasagna C, linguini and clams A, panna cotta A, coffee B, wine list C (way over priced), ambience B+, service C- (wait staff never removed our dessert plates before giving us the check!)..
author: Mark S.

description: Last week while in SF we went to Fior di Italia for lunch. We had been to their old location many times . This visit they brought water and our wine. I looked in my water and there was a bug in it. I told the waiter and he brought another and guess what another bug. My looked in hers and it also had a bug. If they do not pay attention to the condition of their ice machine I wonder what else could be Filthy. Only 1star
author: Alfred C.

description: Ok, bad waited 45 minutes after we ordered our entrées. Just because a restaurant is located in San Francisco does not mean it is great or even good! Their pasta dishes are very sad! Will not go there again.
author: James B.

description: We walked in today in and had a lovely meal. Service was excellent, risottos were all very good but seafood risotto was excellent and the pasta bolognese. The raspberry sorbet and ricotta cheesecake were great.
author: Amalia B.

description: I'm so sad....after years of coming here when we come to SF for the holidays I don't think we will be returning. In the past, we always knew what to expect - spotty service but fairly consistent food. You go here because its a tradition and old school. We knew they had closed and re-opened with new owners so we were hopeful - however the first bummer was the plastic label from the soda gun for Root Beer that was floating in my daughter's soda and the second bummer was the big piece of thick clear plastic that was in the middle of her bolognese. Of course, they didn't charge us for the bolognese and offered dessert on the house which was very nice and we could tell that our server was trying his best. The kids ordered the cannoli and that was not good either - and that means it must have been really bad because my kids don't turn down dessert easily. So to sum it up, I'm sad to lose our tradition but in a town with many great Italian options I'm sure we can start a new one!
author: Julia B.

description: Great food , great history to the place and the waiter and service was top notch made a very good dining experience that bit extra special . I will be back to sample more from a very classic type Italian restaurant
author: Robert S.

description: We have been patrons of Fior d'Italia for many years, my husband for over 30 years and myself for about 15.  We visit this treasure every time we visit the city and are always greeted as if we are family.  We recently introduced my brother to the restaurant and he now is also a fan.  The employees make us feel welcome and appreciated, and the food is authentic and delicious.  We started with a prosciutto wrapped shrimp appetizer and continued on through a delicious cesar salad.  Our entrees consisted of 2 veal entrees, the fruitti de mare and a side of the best fettuccini alfredo I've ever had. Unfortunately, we had no room for desert. They have a nice wine list with a good selection in all price ranges. There is a reason we visit Fior d'Italia at least once every time we are in SF, it consistently exceeds our expectations and we always leave with full tummies and big smiles.
author: Martha V.

description: Great place for peaceful atmosphere and good Italian food, very friendly and quick service. Old style elegant, placed in a hotel easy to get to by walking from the fishermans wharf.
author: Petra K.

description: This is a quaint little Italian joint. The atmosphere is welcoming, the bar tends to a lot of locals, and the staff are very nice. However, there was a disparity between portions sizes and price. My dad and I ordered two antipasto dishes. The prosciutto with fruit was a decent portion, however the burrata, despite being delicious on its own, was incredibly small.  Although, the chocolate balsamic accent around the edge was a nice touch. My dad thoroughly enjoyed the linguini with meatballs, while I opted for the fettuccine alfredo. It was very al dente, but this was a nice change from restaurants that tend to over cook their pasta. I also asked for chicken with my pasta, which costed extra, but they forgot, and I was too hungry and tired to remind them... Fortunately we weren't charged for it. Overall, it's decent Italian food, especially if you are too picky and don't care about it being a bit over-priced.
author: Colleen C.

description: Planned a corporate event here for about 30 people.  Not easy to please that many people, but, Fior d' italia pulled it off.  They were great working with us ahead of time on the specifics for our group, they were flexible with all of the last minute changes.  The service was great for our dinner and they even checked in with me to make sure that we were enjoying ourselves.  I personally had the Salmon as did a number of people in our group and it was delicious, perfectly cooked.  I don't eat dessert normally and the server was nice enough to bring me a bowl of fresh berries ......look forward to coming again in the future.  Also nice jazz band playing that evening
author: Christine W.

description: Service was great, food was delicious. Very accommodating to my kids. The live music was a really nice touch. Loved it!
author: Natasha M.

description: Attentive and suggestive staff   Good food. Nice wine.
author: Tara Y.

description: The food here was good, not outstanding, but good. The reason for only 2 stars is our service was absolute atrocious. The waiter was extremely rude when I asked for a little parmesan cheese with my spaghetti and seafood. I understand that the Chef may not recommend this, but if I want a little cheese I don't think that is a big deal. However, what really solidified the 2 stars, was that we were sitting there with our plates completely cleaned, with our credit card on the table, and glasses empty for so long that the table next to us (who had the waiter check on them twice in the time we were waiting for him) flag the waiter down to say "I think that table wants their check." Apparently, if you aren't a regular, don't expect anything but subpar service. With an abundance of good Italian restaurants in the area, I wouldn't settle on the mediocre service here.
author: Ryan L.

description: Terrible service, average food at best.  Went to a group event , service slow. One person was never served his meal.  They do not hesitate to add a big for no service.  The drinks are expensive, a bloody mary was in a glass with vodke and tomato juice.  NO GARNISH at all.  For $10 one would think there would a sprig of celery at least.
author: Carol F.

description: I visited this twice since they moved to the new location.  Before the move it was expensive but worth it because of the location, ambiance gave it a extra value.  So now it is struggling to measure up to the same celebrity status.  Looks like a hit one visit and miss the next time.  The personnel makes a big difference also.  The last time was during happy hour and with a friend.  I requested a table booth across from the bar. Wanted a comfortable area to have more than happy hour fair.  The water had to ask the owner because the booth sat more than two.  We had cloth napkins and they picked them up because maybe being happy hour and replaced with paper ones.  We had to requested more sourdough bread and food.  They charged us extra for the bread. I thought this was poor customer service .  This is the end of a once iconic  restaurant.
author: Gordon C.

description:
If I were able to give Fior 6 starts instead of 5 I'd so it!

We are a group of 8 and we've gone out to eat together in SF nearly every Friday night for the last 20 years.  Our experience last night at Fior was amazing.  We were greeted by Lalo, the manager, and seated in a private area of the main dining room.  The unhurried service was absolutely impeccable.  We ordered a Zinfandel, which upon tasting was really not to our liking, but we said it would be okay.  The server--without being asked--suggested he take it back and bring us a different wine altogether.  We hesitated but he insisted.  He pleasantly took the bottle away, and brought us a much nicer wine (only a few dollars more than the first).  The menu has many "old style" Italian pastas and entrees.  The side order of three kinds of mushrooms was out-of-this-world.  Everyone enjoyed his or her meal.  The pistachio ice cream and the panna cotta provided an outstanding finale to a thoroughly enjoyable evening.  

I don't understand the bad reviews.  We enjoyed it so much we've made reservations for a return visit in four weeks.
author: tom s.

description: Hadn't been to Fior D'Italia in 10 years (before they moved from North Beach), but found the food hadn't really changed.  Fish dishes were fresh and flavorful, linguine with clams were tasty and tagliatelle bolognese was properly al.dents AZ we'll.as delicious.  Wine list had many good options, but many of the Italian imports were marked up too much.  Atmosphere was quiet, decor simple but very nice and service attentive and efficient.
author: Terry Y.

description: Fior D'Italia just opened late 2012. Went there New Year's Eve. The food was delicious. Authentic Italian. My wife loved the Burrata salad. I had the veal chop which the waiter recommended. Deserts are delicious also.
author: J O.

description: Even tough the location is in The DMZ, the place is still wonderful. Old style decore, tuxedo waiters, friendly and fun. I sat at the bar and had meatballs in a mildly spicey sauce, chicken livers and mushrooms over polenta and a beverage. It was 1/2 happy hour and well worth paying full price. The chef can by to chat, regulars were in attendance and the place felt comfortable. Go here and get some real Italian food.
author: Jan N.

description: What a great neighborhood gem! Had the meatballs at the bar during happy hour, very good. Wife and I had dinner after in the dining room, mine was Bucatini, spicy good. She had the Saltimbocca very nice as well. Waiter was excellent, treated us like family. Overall experience was great! I would definitely return and recommend to my friends and family. Thank you guys!
author: A R.

description: First visit back since re-opening and could not have been more pleased with food, service and ambience! Gianni and Nikko were so welcoming and the salad/pasta and meatballs were extraordinary!  Please take the time and effort to get off the beaten path and visit Fior D'Italia; it will be worth it!
author: carol h.

description: Well where do I begin? I naively came to this place because I saw the hype about it on the food channel. Trust me on this one don't believe in everything you see and hear on TV because you end up looking like a gullible fool like I did. Sadly I came here today for my birthday and let me tell you it is not all that. Shit Olive Garden is better than this place. Let me first start off with the shitty service. The waiter comes and takes our order and as he's taking our order he gets a snappy attitude because my cousin is asking about the meat sauce. Then he doesn't check on us, doesn't refill our water, and then proceeds to take our appetizer and doesn't ask if we are done. Then the food is absolutely awful. We waited an hour for our food no joke and when we finally get it it's cold, bland, and just tasted disgusting. Then when they sing you Happy birthday and bring you the dessert you think it's free but they surprise you at the end when they charge it to the bill and your like wtf most restaurants give you a free desert on your birthday.  Well not this place. Lastly not only is the staff snobby and looks down on you in utter disdain but the clientele does the same thing. We walked in and immediately we got that uncomfortable vibe like we didn't belong there. Then the wtf are you doing here / disdained judgemental looks started throughout the whole night which made the experience even more unpleasant. I felt like I had gone back in time to the 50's when minorities are trying to get a meal at a diner but instead get passive aggressiveness and hostility from the staff and clientele. I smell prejudice.  I mean what did I expect when we were the only Latino family there and everyone else was middle class white baby boomers and their fucking parents. Disgusting!!!! Never coming here again. Shitty service, shitty food, and shitty clientele and way to over priced.
author: Raquel T.

description: We have been looking forward to a reopening, and took the train out from the sunset specifically for some fine Italian dining. So sad and disappointed, we so wanted this to be a good experience. However I can't stress enough how gracious and friendly the service was. We sat at the bar first and ordered mussels and a couple of martinis. The drinks and bartenders were great (very reasonable happy hour BTW), but the mussels came out COLD...I mean even the butter sauce was cold. Decided to hope for the best with dinner. We got a great table, again the staff was a class act, it was such a shame to be so disappointed with both our entrees. The chef agreed to do a chicken parm (not on the menu). That was wrapped up after two bites and went to the dog. It was bone dry..just not edible. We also had the butternut and sage raviolis and brown butter sauce. This was totally dry and had no sauce. Jeez was the sous chef off that night? Then the clincher..I asked for some type of cream sauce to try to save this dish, the waiter came back and said the chef refused. WOW. I asked for it on the side and finally got it for my now cold dish. I don't know what is going on in that kitchen, but at this rate I would be surprised to see them open next week. The two stars are for the staff ...cheers, guys, you are the best.
author: punk l.

description: Recently. our family has enjoyed several dinners, a large fextended amily dinner event, as well a lunch at this fine restuarant. Johnny and Trudy along with Lalo and their service staff have each time provided excellent & very personal table service, very high quality meals with a delicious variety on the menu; prices are reasonable to the venue as well their atmosphere is one of a neighborhood feel.  Their new setting in the old hotel on Mason is perfect as this location was central to the "ole Italian waterfront" which did reach to Water Street at the corner of their building in the early 1900's. Their large venue rooms are perfectly styled to compliment their excellent service and meals. My wife and I feel that Johnny's pride and uncomprising demand for excellence throughout Fior's complete process from kitchen to table ensures that all aspects of this restuarant- service, food, beverages, attitude, as well price, ensure that the patron will always want to return. For years are mainstay when visiting San Francsico was the North Beach Restuarant which is still a fine establishment, yet Fior D'Italia beckons a little more feeling of being with family and of Italy itself, as Johnny and Trudy carefully manage it and interact with thier guests.
author: John Z.
